Roles & Responsibilities
As a University of Applied Learning, SIT works closely with industry in our research pursuits. Our research staff will have the opportunity to be equipped with applied research skill sets that are relevant to industry demands while working on research projects in SIT.
The research staff conducts research in the areas of video analytics for remote pilotage, video compression, advanced sensing techniques, sensor and operation data fusion, data analytics and machine learning algorithms. Participate in and manage the research project with Principal Investigator (PI), Co-PI and the research team members to ensure all project deliverables are met.
Carry out Risk Assessment, and ensure compliance with Work, Safety and Health Regulations.
Work independently, as well as within a team, to ensure proper operation and maintenance of equipment.
Any other duties as assigned

Have relevant competence in the areas of sensing or data analytics or sensor fusion
Have a degree in electrical, or computer engineering or equivalent.
Knowledge of programming, video analytics and compression will be advantageous.
Key Competencies:
Good knowledge in sensing, programming, data analytics.
Possess strong analytical and critical thinking skills.
Show strong initiative and take ownership of work.

job_title: Research Engineer / Fellow (5G-Powered Intelligent Data-Driven Electric Vehicle) - ZW
job_description:
Roles & Responsibilities
The Singapore Institute of Technology (SIT) is a public autonomous university and the third largest university by intake in Singapore. SIT’s mission is to innovate with industry, through an integrated applied learning and research approach, so as to contribute to the economy and society. Singapore is the small city with a big dream. We are home to the best talent and have the world’s highest per capital investment in science and technology.

We have an opening for Research Fellow or Research Engineer. The selected applicant is expected to lead and pursue high-quality research in applied artificial intelligence and sustainability that lead to publications in top-tier international conferences and journals, as well as real-world implementations. If interested, please send your resume including a cover letter, CV and a brief statement of your work undertaken in previous work.

Key Responsibilities:

Roles & Responsibilities
Driven by the passion to improve quality of people’s lives, WS Audiology continues to grow as market leader in the hearing aid industry. With our commitment to increase penetration in an underserved hearing care market, we want to accelerate our business transformation in order to reach more people, more effectively.
We are seeking a well-rounded data engineer to join our team. As part of the Global Post Market Quality and Data Analytics team, you will play an integral role in processing consumer feedback through data quality assurance, data modelling, data integration and automation. Under a diverse team, you will have a plethora of opportunities to work cross-culturally and cross-functionally to streamline data processes.
What you will do
Build and maintain data pipelines for efficient data movement. Use ETL processes to extract and store data from various sources and transform it into a clean and usable format.
Develop and implement data models to support business intelligence, reporting and analytics requirements.
Integrate data from different sources (internal/external) to provide a unified and comprehensive view of the data.
Implement data quality checks and validation processes to ensure the accuracy and reliability of the data. Identify and address data quality issues.
Write scripts and use automation tools to streamline data processes and workflows.
Collaborate with stakeholders within and outside of the team to understand data needs and streamline data.
What you bring
Experience
Bachelor's degree in Data science, Computer Engineering, Computing, IT or any other related field.
3+ years of relevant working experience in data roles.
SQL, Power BI and Advanced Excel knowledge required. Proficiency in other programming languages is a plus.
Familiarity with integrating data sets from various systems, identifying gaps and presenting visualized data using Power BI.
Able to handle structured data from various sources and formats (e.g.: from customers and operations), such as complaints and returns.
Basic knowledge in quality processes (medical device industry) is a plus.
Personal competencies
Great team player and good communicator. Able to break down complex concepts in a simple and clear manner.
Responsible with a good sense of urgency.
Who we are
At WS Audiology, we provide innovative hearing aids and hearing health services.
Together with our 12,000 colleagues in 130 countries, we invite you to help unlock human potential by bringing back hearing for millions of people around the world.
With us, you will become part of a truly global company where we care for one another, welcome diversity and celebrate our successes.
Sounds wonderful? We can't wait to hear from you.
WS Audiology is an equal-opportunity employer and committed to creating an inclusive employee experience for all. Regardless of race, color, religion, national origin, age, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, marital status, medical condition, ancestry, disability, military or veteran status we firmly believe that our work is at its best when everyone feels free to be their most authentic self.

company_name: NATIONAL UNIVERSITY HEALTH SYSTEM PTE. LTD.
job_description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Career in the Hospital

Join our incredible team at the National University Hospital (NUH), where we
believe that a hospital is more than just a workplace. Every day, we witness the
remarkable impact that our healthcare professionals can have on individuals, families, and entire communities.At NUH, we are driven by a shared purpose – to lend a helping hand to those in need, to be a source of support and healing, and to empower patients to live their best lives.

We are looking for passionate and committed individuals to join us as we transform lives and create a lasting impact in the lives of our patients. The impact you make at NUH will be profound, regardless of the role you take up in the hospital.

About NUH

The National University Hospital (NUH) is Singapore’s leading university hospital, with a proud heritage dating back to 1905 with the establishment of what’s now the NUS Yong Loo Lin School of Medicine. Our strong ties with the medical school have shaped us into a unique institution, allowing us to seamlessly integrate clinical. care with teaching and research. As a university hospital, we go beyond the realm of providing tertiary medical care. We are a hub of knowledge and innovation, attracting healthcare professionals who are passionate about pushing boundaries and making significant contributions to the field.

About Department and Purpose of the Position The National University Cancer Institute, Singapore (NCIS) is a national specialist centre under the National University Health System (NUHS). It is the only public cancer centre in Singapore treating both paediatric and adult cancers in one facility. We are looking for a business intelligence analyst/scientist in NCIS to manage corporate data and informatics needs to support cluster, departments, and specialties within NCIS. Responsibilities also involve overseeing the informatics team and support in ground operation projects.

Key Responsibilities
Primary Responsibilities and Duties (80%) Working with stakeholders and users, perform data analysis, trend observations and derive actionable insights to drive improvement initiatives.
Ensure proper extraction, validation, and storage of data from various systems.
Conceptualise and develop operational dashboards to meet the business needs and to provide quality oncology care.
Work with the team to design and architect the workflow of the data and algorithms including data input, output and storage between varioushealth IT systems.
Perform data analytics and/or data mining from various systems
Collate clinical and management information for the department and hospital.
Provide regular updates highlighting concerns to Section Heads and Headof Department.
Secondary Responsibilities and Duties (20%)

Manage IT projects and/or new system implementation.
Oversee design, development, and maintenance of in-house application systems.
Track department's servers, workstations, and end-user equipment.
Collate annual budget for IT systems,equipment, and software. Coordinate acquisition and implementation.
Assess operational needs and recommend and implement IT solutions.
Oversee Informatics team and ensure staff meet KPIs.
Perform other assignments as delegated by Sections Head and Head of Department.

Key Requirements:
A recognised degree in Mathematics, IT or Data Analytics with at least 4 years of relevant experience
Good system and data analysis and reporting skills.
Knowledge in data visualisation / analytical / statistical tools (e.g., Tableau, R, Python) will be an advantage.
Good organisational and interpersonal skills
Practical knowledge of hospital operations, medical systems/applications, data analytics would be an advantage.
Closing & Applications

When you join NUH, you become part of a dynamic and collaborative environment where expertise, knowledge, and compassion all come together.
Working in healthcare offers satisfaction that extend far beyond the ordinary. The smiles of gratitude from patients and the profound sense of fulfilment that comes from helping others cannot be measured. It is a career that allows for both personal and professional growth. The challenges you encounter in this rapidly evolving industry push you to constantly expand your knowledge and skills, as well as encourage lifelong learning.Be a part of a team that gets to create a transformative healthcare experience for our patients and professionals alike.

Roles & Responsibilities
Join our dynamic team as we embark on pioneering advancements in data science and advanced analytics. As a key member, you'll play a crucial role in driving insights, value, and innovation from data, shaping the future of revenue collection systems.

Main Responsibilities:
Define data science and advanced analytics requirements, create data exploitation models, recommend tool selection, and collaborate closely with Revenue Collection system Business Leads and Experts to derive insights and value from data.
Planned, executed, and delivered advanced data analytics and scenario modelling.
Lead activities for use case capture, model building, problem analysis, data exploration, and integration.
Research existing products and machine learning/deep learning models, propose improvements and industrialize the product.
Participate in model demonstration and validation with end customers, providing analysis and evidence of model performance for production and operation.
Collaborate with the product leader, domain expert, and software development team to ensure successful delivery.
Requirements:
Bachelor's or Master's Degree in Data Science or related field.
Minimum 2 years of experience in artificial intelligence algorithms with a proven track record in implementing Deep learning solutions.
Previous experience in an innovation environment is advantageous.
Understanding of algorithm design and development, from database preparation to algorithm industrialization.
Experience in developing and deploying computer vision algorithms for real-world applications.
Proficiency with Python, TensorFlow, Keras, PyTorch, Pandas, Jupyter Notebook, and GitLab.
Experience in software development, MLOps, and data engineering (ETL pipeline implementation) using Spark, Flink, or Pandas is highly recommended.
Previous experience in Mass Rapid Transport systems such as fare collection or Metro station data analytics systems is highly recommended.
Previous experience in video analytics, performance, and image process optimization is desirable.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Excellent project and time management skills with experience in Agile techniques.
Ability to work both independently and in a team.

Roles & Responsibilities
We are looking for aspiring Data Engineer/Software Developer to join our product development team, you will be responsible for the design and implementation of data integration pipeline and asynchronous data event using event driven architecture approach to consolidate data from various sources and systems.

About the Role
· Collaborating with a team of highly skilled Software Engineers and Data Engineers in deploying and delivering software products.
· Actively participating in product enhancement, particularly in the areas of integration and UI, to improve product quality and configurability.
· Taking ownership of the development of key software components.

· Design and develop integration connectors to facilitate data integration from multiple sources and systems, including databases, APIs, log files, streaming platforms, IoT end devices and external data providers.
· Data Transformation and Processing: Develop data transformation routines to clean, normalize, and aggregate data. Apply data processing techniques to handle complex data structures, handle missing or inconsistent data, and prepare the data for analysis or reporting.
· Strong knowledge of data manipulation languages such as SQL necessary to build and maintain complex queries and data pipelines.
· Implement event-driven processing pipelines using frameworks like Solace Pubsub, Apache Kafka, MQTT, AMQP.
· Ensure compliance to data governance policies and standards to ensure data quality, integrity, security and consistency.
· Experience working in a dynamic environment with managing senior stakeholders from different organisations and agencies.

Requirements

· Proficiency in at least one object-oriented language; Java skills are highly desirable.
· Deep understanding in designing, implementing data lifecycle management.
· Deep understanding of Event driven architecture, data producers and consumers.
· Knowledge on data analytics pipeline, data lakehouse & warehouse concept. Curate data for exporting to data analytics tools for data processing pipeline to provide business analytics outcomes.
· Experience with relational and non-relational databases
· Familiar with Product Development and Design thinking approach
· Excellent communication, collaboration, and problem-solving skills
· Ability to work independently and as part of a team.

Roles & Responsibilities
About Accenture:
Accenture is a leading global professional services company that helps the world’s leading businesses, governments and other organizations build their digital core, optimize their operations, accelerate revenue growth and enhance citizen services—creating tangible value at speed and scale. We are a talent and innovation led company with 738,000 people serving clients in more than 120 countries. Technology is at the core of change today, and we are one of the world’s leaders in helping drive that change, with strong ecosystem relationships. We combine our strength in technology with unmatched industry experience, functional expertise and global delivery capability. We are uniquely able to deliver tangible outcomes because of our broad range of services, solutions and assets across Strategy & Consulting, Technology, Operations, Industry X and Accenture Song. These capabilities, together with our culture of shared success and commitment to creating 360° value, enable us to help our clients succeed and build trusted, lasting relationships. We measure our success by the 360° value we create for our clients, each other, our shareholders, partners and communities. Visit us at www.accenture.com.
About Our People:
People in our Business & Technology Integration career track excel in:
• Driving Sales
• Providing thought leadership and mindshare
• Delivering value to clients through differentiated solutions (ie. solution architecting, blueprint design, development of a solution, service, capability or offering). They are expected to balance
• Sales and Pre-sales

Manage senior client stakeholders

Strategise, plan and build capability to stay ahead of market demand and need

Manage a team and provide opportunities for career progression

Create and share of PoVs, offerings and comparisons related to Analytics, Intelligence, Extensibility and Integration technologies, solutions and innovation

job_title: Data Scientist, Risk Data Mining - BRIC - Singapore
job_description:
Roles & Responsibilities
TikTok is the leading destination for short-form mobile video. Our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. TikTok has global offices including Los Angeles, New York, London, Paris, Berlin, Dubai, Singapore, Jakarta, Seoul and Tokyo.
The Business Risk Integrated Control (BRIC) team is missioned to:
- Protect ByteDance users, including and beyond content consumers, creators, advertisers;
- Secure platform health and community experience authenticity;
- Build infrastructures, platforms and technologies, as well as to collaborate with many cross-functional teams and stakeholders.
The BRIC team works to minimize the damage of inauthentic behaviors on ByteDance platforms (e.g. TikTok, CapCut, Resso, Lark), covering multiple classical and novel community and business risk areas such as account integrity, engagement authenticity, anti spam, API abuse, growth fraud, live streaming security and financial safety (ads or e-commerce), etc.
In this team you'll have a unique opportunity to have first-hand exposure to the strategy of the company in key security initiatives, especially in building scalable and robust, intelligent and privacy-safe, secure and product-friendly systems and solutions. Our challenges are not some regular day-to-day technical puzzles -- You'll be part of a team that's developing novel solutions to first-seen challenges of a non-stop evolvement of a phenomenal product eco-system. The work needs to be fast, transferrable, while still down to the ground to making quick and solid differences.
Responsibilities:
- Build rules, algorithms and machine learning models, to respond to and mitigate business risks in ByteDance products/platforms. Such risks include and are not limited to abusive accounts, fake engagements, spammy redirection, scraping, fraud, etc.
- Analyze business and security data, uncover evolving attack motion, identify weaknesses and opportunities in risk defense solutions, explore new space from the discoveries.
- Define risk control measurements. Quantify, generalize and monitor risk related business and operational metrics. Align risk teams and their stakeholders on risk control numeric goals, promote impact-oriented, data-driven data science practices for risks.
Qualifications:
- Bachelor or degrees above in computer science, statistics, math, internet security or other relevant STEM majors (e.g. finance if applying for financial fraud roles).
- At least 3 years with solid data science skills. Proficiency in statistical analytical tools, such as SQL, R and Python.
- Familiarity with machine learning or social/content online platform analytics. Bonus given to proficiency in modern machine learning applications.
- Ability to think critically, objectively, rationally. Reason and communicate in result-oriented, data-driven manner. High autonomy.

Roles & Responsibilities
PRODUCT AREA
Google Cloud accelerates every organization’s ability to digitally transform its business and industry. We deliver enterprise-grade solutions that leverage Google’s cutting-edge technology, and tools that help developers build more sustainably. Customers in more than 200 countries and territories turn to Google Cloud as their trusted partner to enable growth and solve their most critical business problems.

JOB DESCRIPTION
The Google Cloud Platform team helps customers transform and build what's next for their business — all with technology built in the cloud. Our products are developed for security, reliability and scalability, running the full stack from infrastructure to applications to devices and hardware. Our teams are dedicated to helping our customers — developers, small and large businesses, educational institutions and government agencies — see the benefits of our technology come to life. As part of an entrepreneurial team in this rapidly growing business, you will play a key role in understanding the needs of our customers and help shape the future of businesses of all sizes use technology to connect with customers, employees and partners.

ADDITIONAL JOB DESCRIPTION
As a Customer Engineer on the Cloud Intelligence team, you will be the Subject Matter Expert (SME) who advises customers on the differences between Google Cloud Platform (GCP) offerings. You will engage with the Sales teams, Customer Engineering teams, Marketing, and field leadership to position and differentiate from competition and help land wins. You'll master the latest technologies across multiple public cloud providers to help customers build solutions on GCP.

Qualifications
JOB RESPONSIBILITIES
Guide technical and business decision-makers through their Cloud selection process.
Stay up-to-date with the ecosystem of software vendors in the Cloud space by analyzing OpenAI and open-source services to extract technical and business insights that drive reference architectures, runbooks, blogs, and training content.
Create field enablement materials for internal communities of SMEs and the broader GCP field (solutions architects, sellers, and consultants) to help them understand how our offerings integrate and compare with other Cloud Service Provider’s offerings.
Work with customers’ development and data science teams to deeply understand their business and technical needs, and design solutions that make the best use of the GCP cloud platform and services to address their requirements.
Create and adopt assets and automation.
MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS
8 years of customer-facing experience as a solutions architect, data scientist, technical consultant, or technical pre-sales.
5 years of experience in all phases of the pre-sales cloud engagements.
Experience in deploying, fine-tuning, and consuming proprietary and open-source Cloud Native services.
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
Certification in Google Cloud or similar.
Experience with thought leadership and innovation around Cloud Transformation.
Experience as a leader bringing mentorship, with the ability to work in a matrix environment across stakeholders.
Ability to be a trusted advisor to customers by building, guiding, and facilitating relationships with technical executives, data scientists, and system architects.
Excellent problem-solving skills, with the ability to analyze problems and develop actionable plans quickly.
Excellent communication and presentation skills.

Roles & Responsibilities
Senior Strategic Consultant - Travel

Reporting to the Director of Strategic Consulting, the Senior Strategic Consultant has the responsibility for supporting all aspects of the pre-sales process and, in conjunction with an Executive Account Manager, navigates and guides PROS prospects through initial solution identification to a decision to purchase.

The Company - PROS:
PROS Holdings, Inc. (NYSE: PRO) is leading the shift to modern commerce, helping competitive enterprises create a personalized and frictionless experience for their customers. Powered with Dynamic Pricing Science, PROS solutions make it possible for companies to price, configure and sell their products and services with speed, precision and consistency across all sales channels. Our customers lead their markets across more than 10 sectors, and benefit from 30+ years of accumulated knowledge and data science infused into our purpose- built solutions. PROS drives more than 200 million prices and 1.7 billion forecasts every day for enterprises in more than 30 industries around the globe. Our mission is to help companies and the people who work for them outperform. To learn more, visit pros.com.

A Day in the Life of the Senior Strategic Consultant - About the role:
Differentiates PROS Airline solutions from the competition by:
Demonstrating in the software how PROS can meet the customer’s immediate requirements, while also providing unique capabilities to further improve their revenue performance.
Explaining PROS industry proven scientific forecasting and optimization capabilities.
Mapping PROS’ RM, sales and availability capabilities to the business needs of the airline.
Discussing anecdotes about how leading airlines are using PROS to improve their sales and RM practices and performance.
Developing a value case analysis to assist customers with their decision.
Confidently answering questions about how PROS solves specific challenges customers face.
Works with the customer to jointly develop the business justification for the purchase.
As part of the account team, develops the winning sales strategy for each opportunity.
Using thought leadership and industry knowledge, builds relationships and trust at all levels within the customer’s organization, from analysts to CEO.
Actively participates in relevant blogs and webinars, presents at conferences, and contributes to whitepapers.
Adjusts their communication style in response to different environments and cultures around the world.
Provides ideas for further product enhancement to the Product Management team.
Post-contract, transitions the knowledge of the customer and solution to the implementation team, enabling the team to be immediately effective.
Participates in customer health checks to ensure customers are effectively using PROS solutions and continuing to adhere to best practices.
Proactively maintains product and industry expertise, staying on the front edge of leading industry science and best practices.
Capable of communicating scientific forecasting and optimization methods, dynamic pricing, availability management, fare quoting and merchandising, Leg/Seg vs. Origin Destination (O&D) RM, and group sales best practices.
Required Qualifications - About you:

We are looking for candidates who possess the combination of the following achievements, skills, and behaviors:
15+ years team lead experience in airline RM, distribution, pricing, and/or ecommerce.
15+ years senior pre-sales enterprise / applications / solution sales and/or consulting experience.
Deep expertise in industry leading RM, pricing, availability, shopping, and merchandising solutions.
Knowledge in NDC and One Order IATA initiatives, Reservation and Global Distribution Systems (GDS), ATPCO fare rules, dynamic pricing, availability management, merchandising and ancillary revenue practices.
Thorough understanding of travel competitive landscape.
Strong and confident communication, both verbal and written.
Demonstrated experience exceeding goals and financial targets.
Experience developing go-to-market plans, business cases, and ROI / TCO cases.
Bachelor’s Degree in Operations Research, Engineering, Statistics, or Business. MBA a plus.
English: Full Professional Proficiency.
Willing to travel approximately 75% of the time to prospects and customers around the world.
Travel to Houston corporate office, typically quarterly.
Skills and Personal Characteristics:
Ownership
Passion
Pride
Trust
Integrity
Innovation
Customer Centricity
Why PROS?

This is a unique opportunity to join the market leading company that has not only has 30+ years of proven success but also has a significantly under penetrated opportunity in a $30B addressable market.
PROS culture and the truly extraordinary people who work here are at the very core of our success. We have a passion for what we do, and we won’t stop until we’ve delivered on our promises. We’re committed to the success of our customers. That’s why we think harder and dream bigger – so our customers can go even further than they ever imagined possible.

Roles & Responsibilities
The Genome Institute of Singapore (GIS) is Singapore's flagship institute for the genomic sciences. The Agency for Science, Technology and Research (A*STAR) is the parent funding body for the GIS and has a long-term commitment to advance science and develop innovative technology to further economic growth and improve lives. As one of the world's premier genomic centres, the GIS integrates genetics, genomics, high-throughput biology, and data science to gain fundamental, translational and clinical insights into human disease and health (https://www.a-star.edu.sg/gis/).
The GIS invites applications for outstanding Principal Investigators to develop their independent research programmes in the following domains:
Build technologies to engineer DNA or RNA (including molecular biology, viral/non-viral delivery, modified DNA/RNA, machine learning, CRISPR-Cas, DNAzymes/ribozymes, and other editing systems). Candidates with established track record in molecular engineering, nucleic acid therapeutics, translation into clinical trials, and/or biotech companies are highly desirable.
Build technologies in RNA therapeutics (including either using RNA as medicine or targeting RNA in diseases). Candidates with an established track record in targeting RNA or engineering RNA for protein production, decay, localization in health and disease systems are highly desirable.
Qualified candidates should have an MD, PhD or equivalent degree in the biological, genomic or computational sciences, and a demonstrated ability to conduct cutting-edge team-based research with a strong record of peer-reviewed publications, intellectual property creation, and external funding. You must be comfortable working in a dynamic research organisation and be able to balance multiple responsibilities. Strong communication skills and a willingness to work collaboratively in a multidisciplinary environment are critical for success. The successful candidate will drive an expansion into the indicated research areas and complement and synergise with ongoing research programmes at the GIS.

job_title: Lead / Senior / Data Management Analyst (Retirement & Health Study Office)
job_description:
Roles & Responsibilities
As a member of Team Central Provident Fund (CPF), you will play a crucial role in helping over 4 million members save for their retirement, healthcare, and housing needs as well as helping them cope with life’s uncertainties. With a fulfilling career, career growth, and development opportunities, you will be part of a big family of dedicated professionals. Join us and champion financial security for Singaporeans while leaving a lasting legacy.
What you will be working on
We are seeking a Data Management Analyst to join the Retirement & Health Study Office (RHSO). The RHSO oversees the Retirement & Health Study, a longitudinal survey involving over 20,000 individuals in Singapore, aimed at understanding how retirement and healthcare demands evolve with age. Over the past decade, the study has tracked the retirement, health, and various outcomes of this cohort, with the data being widely utilized by government agencies and academia for policy decisions. If you are enthusiastic about managing high-quality longitudinal data related to aging, and possess experience in data management and modelling, we encourage you to apply for this exciting opportunity.
Your broad area of responsibilities include
Undertake a broad range of data quality assurance activities to ensure that the data is error-free, complete, and unbiased.
Conduct comprehensive data quality assurance activities to ensure accuracy, completeness, and integrity of datasets.
Implement and enforce quality control measures throughout the data lifecycle
Oversee the organisation, storage, and retrieval of datasets.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to establish and maintain efficient data management processes.
Work on data science projects to enhance the data quality, or execution of the study.
Collaborate closely with external entities, including survey companies, academic institutions, and government agencies, to coordinate and execute the study's planning.
Facilitate seamless data sharing processes as part of the collaborative efforts.
Maintain detailed documentation of data quality processes, methodologies, and project-related activities.
Create and update documentation to ensure transparency and replicability of processes.
Identify areas for improvement in data quality and management processes.
Propose and implement enhancements to optimize efficiency and effectiveness.
What we are looking for
Relevant experience in data management and quality control.
Prior experience in statistical data management would be preferred.
Proficiency in statistical analysis tools and data visualisation platforms.
Ability to apply relevant statistical and analytical tools as well as techniques for data processing and compilation.
Good proficiency in programming such as STATA, Python, R.
Good experience in coordinating and executing study planning activities with external partners.
Strong communication and collaboration skills to work closely with external entities, including survey companies, academic institutions, and government agencies.
Seniority of appointment will commensurate with relevant work experience
What you can expect
A challenging and rewarding career
A variety of formal and informal training to enhance your skills in the evolving technology landscape
Promotion opportunities based on your capability and on-the-job performance
A friendly work environment with like-minded colleagues to co-create and collaborate together
A hybrid work model allowing remote work for up to 50% of the time, contingent upon the exigencies of service
A productive yet growth-oriented workplace with a flexible dress code empowering you to decide your appropriate outfit for the day
A comprehensive rewards package
Annual leave and pro-family leave
Medical and dental benefits
Access to recreational activities
Position is on a 1-year full-time contract directly under the payroll of CPF Board with an option to renew, contingent upon confirmation and subject to organisational needs. Additionally, there is potential for emplacement into a permanent position

Roles & Responsibilities
Who We Are
We are an Artificial Intelligence (AI) technology backed by Shell, one of the world's leading energy companies, dedicated to tackling the most complex issues in the energy sector through groundbreaking research and development in AI and Data Science. Founded in Singapore, our ultimate goal is to establish ourselves as the leading hub for AI and Data Science R&D in Southeast Asia.
We are looking for a Software Engineer to join our dynamic team. As a Software Engineer, you will work on designing, developing, and improving key components of the technology stack related to AI, data engineering, high-performance computing (HPC), and geophysics, among other specialized topics. We are looking for people from various development backgrounds but most importantly someone who is passionate about solving challenging problems and can think out of the box.

Responsibilities
Design, develop, and improve key components of the technology stack in high-paced, high-impact real-world projects.
Apply the technology to real work and high-impact client projects.
Maintain high code quality standards and be accountable for the work delivered.
Requirements
Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computing, Science, or Engineering with 2 years of software development experience.
High proficiency in Python is a must. Experience in C, C++, Rust, or other programming languages is a plus.
Good aptitude for abstract thinking and problem-solving. Good understanding of complex algorithms and data structures.
Experience is required with essential development tools such as Git, Linux Shell Scripting, Vim/Emacs, etc.
Experience with parallel computing, system programming, full-stack development, and web development can be a plus.
Ability to work effectively in a fast-paced environment with high expectations.

Benefits
Why Join LRD?
LRD offers a conducive work environment in a company culture that values authenticity, integrity, technical skills, teamwork, and results. Here are some of the opportunities offered by the position:
You are always presented with new challenges to solve intellectually stimulating problems. The work never gets stale, mundane, or boring.
Continuous learning opportunities to develop your technical expertise in many subfields of AI, ML, HPC, Geoscience, Engineering, etc.
Your work will have an immediate impact on high-impact real-world problems such as natural resource exploration and energy security.
Have your work recognized with publication opportunities in top scientific conferences and journals.
Be rewarded for your contributions with high-performance bonuses well above the market rate.
Friendly and casual working environment.

job_title: Senior / Research Scientist (High Performance Computing Branch)
job_description:
Roles & Responsibilities
[What the role is]
The Centre for Climate Research Singapore (CCRS) is a division of the Meteorological Service Singapore (MSS). At CCRS, our mission is to advance scientific understanding of tropical climate variability and change and its associated weather systems affecting Singapore and the wider Southeast Asia region, so that the knowledge and expertise can benefit decision makers and the community. Our vision is to be a world leading centre in tropical climate and weather research focussing on the Southeast Asia region.
Within CCRS, the High Performance Computing (HPC) Branch is responsible for the technical development, optimization, implementation and management of CCRS’s software systems running on in-house ‘Utama’ and Singapore National Supercomputing Centre (NSCC) HPC systems. CCRS’s core ‘SINGV’ weather/climate modelling system is a regional, tropical configuration of the Unified Model (UM), used in both weather (Numerical Weather Prediction – NWP) and climate change (regional climate projections) applications. CCRS is also enhancing its rainfall nowcasting capabilities (predicting heavy rainfall in Singapore over the next 30-60 minutes) using machine learning techniques in collaboration with local and international partners.
This position will further enhance CCRS’s software engineering capabilities, focussing on the technical development, optimization, implementation and monitoring of CCRS’s operational rainfall nowcasting and NWP systems.
[What you will be working on]
Configuration management and operational implementation of CCRS nowcasting / NWP software and suites
Computational optimisation of nowcasting / NWP systems running on GPU-/CPU-based HPC architectures
Monitoring and troubleshooting of nowcasting / NWP systems running operationally on CCRS’s HPC platforms
Effective collaborative software development with external national/international partners
[What we are looking for]
The job might be for you if you possess the following:
Degree, Masters or PhD in physical, computational or data science, or a related subject.
Skilled in common scientific programming languages, ideally Python, Fortran, UNIX shell scripting, and/or C/C++.
Experience in the administration and troubleshooting of UNIX-based research/operational supercomputers/servers.
Familiar with use of data transfer protocols and management of very large datasets.
Practical experience in one or more of the following software tools would be an advantage: Cylc Workflow Engine, containerisation, machine learning.
At least 3 years of active scientific software development/testing on CPU- and/or GPU-based HPC systems (Desirable)
Familiarity with software configuration management tools, ideally Subversion and/or Git. (Desirable)
Designing and integrating complex modelling workflows in research and/or operational software environments (Desirable).
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Good communication and collaboration skills.
Ability to multi-task.
Ability to work effectively to deadlines on individual projects and as part of a diverse team.
As part of the shortlisting process for this role, you may be required to complete a medical declaration and/or undergo further assessment.
Applicants will be updated on the status of their applications within 4 weeks of the closing date of this job posting.

We believe that together we can transform industries, grow economics, lift societies, and sustain our environment. Because it’s the best-run businesses that make the world run better and improve people’s lives. At SAP, we build breakthroughs, together.

About SAP Labs Singapore
SAP Labs Singapore is the 20th engineering hub in the SAP Labs Network and is the newest innovation hub at SAP that drives product leadership, fosters the best talent, and aims to boost ecosystem and community engagement with a variety of initiatives.

SAP Labs Singapore has the ambition to expand significantly and become the Embedded Artificial Intelligence Hub for SAP, leveraging on core competencies in the current teams.

Your future team
Artificial Intelligence team as part of SAP Labs Singapore has experienced professionals taking on challenges posed by the SAP customers. Based in Singapore, you will have the opportunity to work on breakthrough projects addressing real-world problems, challenging norms with some of the SAP’s key customers. As part of the global product engineering team, you will participate in rich and engaging conversations with experts around the globe.
SAP Labs Singapore provides an open, modern working environment and the opportunity to become part of the global SAP engineering community.

Purpose and objectives
As an Associate AI Scientist / AI Scientist, you will work together with a team of dedicated experts including AI developers, data engineers, dev-ops engineers, and architects with a single goal of building the best-in-class AI products. You will work against fixed timelines and your success will be measured by the ability to deliver solutions matching the performance of top-notch artificial intelligence systems.
Applicants with relevant experience may be considered for AI Scientist role.

Expectations and tasks
Your tasks include:
Push the frontiers of what is possible in the area of artificial intelligence and machine learning so as to create new solutions
Explore, understand, and implement most recent technologies and approaches for data science problems
Comfortably handle multi-terabyte data sets in scale-up and scale-out environments
Strive for state-of-the art, highly accurate and scalable data science models
Understand business processes which create and consume data to be able to select best approaches, evaluate their performance and assess business relevance
Create excellence both in terms of results quality and system scalability through continuous evaluation, analysis, and refinement of the system implementation
Communicate the relevance of implemented systems and achieved results in a visual and consistent way
Work closely with the team, customers, and partners to holistically understand business and user requirements and derive adequate application development concepts
Performing quality assurance tasks
Solve complex regression issues
Ability to work in global teams with different time zones
Immerse yourself quickly into new topics, terminology, and development tasks
Educational and experience requirements
Required
Undergraduate or Post-Graduate specialization in Artificial Intelligence or Ph.D. degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, or equivalent fields
0 to 3 years of working experience as data scientist, preferrable with an enterprise software or cloud application companies
Publication track record on deep learning, machine learning, large language, and foundational models
Proficient knowledge and track record of applying modern deep learning concepts
Track record of developing novel learning algorithms or systems
Experience with machine and deep learning software packages & libraries such as Caffe, Torch, Theano, TensorFlow, Keras, Scikit-learn, DeepLearning4j, GPT;
Hands-on with programming languages such as Python, C++, Java, Scala
Familiar with Agile/Scrum methodologies
Strong desire to overcome obstacles and make your work benefit SAP's customers
Excellent written and communication skills in English language
Optional
Operational knowledge of Linux distributions such as Redhat, Ubuntu, SUSE
Data Science experience in Large Language Models, Generative Pre-trained Transformer models, foundational models etc.
Job Segment: Data Science, AI Developer, Machine Learning, Artificial Intelligence

job_title: Data Scientist - Applied Research and Technology Consultant
job_description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Overview:
We are seeking a highly skilled and dynamic Data Scientist with a strong background in applied research and a passion for exploring cutting-edge technologies in the field of AI. The ideal candidate will not only possess advanced analytical and technical skills but also excel in consulting and due diligence, playing a crucial role in identifying and integrating innovative AI technologies into our organization. The candidate should have broad knowledge and experience in generative AI in the natural language, image, video, and other application domains.

Responsibilities:
Applied Research:
Conduct in-depth research to identify and understand industry trends, emerging technologies, and best practices in data science and AI.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to design and implement practical data-driven solutions that address real-world challenges and drive business outcomes.
Identify, research, and develop new capabilities and functionality into Aicadium products, in the domains of Industrial Computer Vision and Multimodal Foundation models.
Consulting:
Engage with internal and external stakeholders to understand their business needs and challenges, providing strategic guidance on leveraging data science and AI for optimal outcomes.
Act as a consultant, translating complex technical concepts into actionable insights for non-technical audiences.
Technology Exploration:
Stay abreast of the latest advancements in AI and data science, actively exploring and evaluating new technologies to enhance our organization's capabilities.
Collaborate with internal teams to identify areas where innovative technologies can be applied to solve existing problems or create new opportunities.
Help drive innovation and new technology adoption within Aicadium.
Proof-of-Concept (POC) Development:
Rapidly develop POCs utilizing new Generative AI technologies and models.
These POCs will involve use case discovery, implementation, and testing of Generative AI models, frameworks, or platforms to evaluate their feasibility and potential impact.
The applied research team will deliver functional prototypes and concise reports summarizing the POC results, including insights on the technology's applicability, limitations, and potential commercial value.
Due Diligence:
Conduct thorough due diligence on potential AI technologies and solutions, assessing their feasibility, scalability, and alignment with organizational goals.
Collaborate with legal and compliance teams to ensure adherence to regulatory requirements and ethical considerations.
Collaboration:
Work closely with cross-functional teams, including engineers, product managers, and business analysts, to integrate data-driven solutions into existing systems and processes.
Foster a collaborative and innovative environment by sharing knowledge, insights, and best practices with team members.
Qualifications:
Master's or Ph.D. in a quantitative field such as ML, Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Physics, or a related discipline.
Proven experience in applied research, focusing on developing and implementing efficient data-driven solutions.
Broad knowledge and hands-on experience with generative AI approaches and technologies.
Deep technical understanding of generative AI models, frameworks, libraries, and tools; their capabilities and limitations, data requirements, training, management, software infrastructure, scalability, security, and technical viability.
Demonstrated ability to communicate complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders effectively.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, keen interest in exploring, testing, and adopting new technologies.
Keen interest in the latest developments in AI and ML, and a strong ability to distinguish truth from hype.
Strong programming skills in Python and modern ML frameworks.
Strong background in modern and emerging ML methods and architectures.
Experience in due diligence and technology assessment in the AI domain is highly desirable.
Experience in consulting is highly desirable.

job_title: Senior Manager, Supply Chain Planning and Analytics
job_description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Overview
“Microsoft’s mission is to empower every person and every organization on the planet to achieve more. As employees we come together with a growth mindset, innovate to empower others and collaborate to realize our shared goals. Each day we build on our values of respect, integrity, and accountability to create a culture of inclusion where everyone can thrive at work and beyond.”
The Senior Manager, Supply Chain Planning and Analytics will drive the requirements for the development of new or revised statistical systems, problem solving, or investigation related to modeling. They will need to be able to work in a self-start environment, apply high-level problem-solving skills and model a can-do attitude. They will drive process simplification and operational adoption of processes in partnership with the value stream owners, ensuring a connection across the overall ecosystem, as we scale the organization. In this role, you will partner and establish relationships by building trust with internal and external stakeholders, develop and execute strategies to meet business outcomes.
The successful candidate must be a self-starter with proven skills in driving key initiatives with results through engagement with external and internal partners and have a solid business acumen. The candidate will be a problem solver and be resourceful, able to drive change, creative and willing to work with and through others to be successful.
The candidate must have the ability to demonstrate the value of the solution (not just demonstrate the functionality) and build strong relationships with internal customers. Strong executive verbal and written communications skills and analytical thinking are necessary for driving a high level of impact.
In alignment with our Microsoft values, we are committed to cultivating an inclusive work environment for all employees to positively impact our culture every day.

Responsibilities
Lead project teams in support of different project workstreams, and manage overall project activities, plans and schedules associated with deliverables and milestones.
Lead, guide and support multiple workstream leads / consultants through the design and implementation of targeted change strategies including identification of change impacts to people, process, policy and structure, stakeholder identification and alignment, appropriate communication and feedback loops, success measures, training, organizational readiness and long-term sustainability.
Ability to synthesize numerous sources of information to create long range forecasting model while ensuring that operations are reflective of the plan.
Leads, drive day-to-day change management activities while providing the appropriate levels of support and coaching of peer/team members.
Recommend appropriate new or revised change management tools and practices.
Bring Supply Chain experience and help to shape the vision in alignment with the overall Global Supply Chain core team.
Baseline of current process and drive lean processes on regional basis.
Evaluate and engage with internal and external stakeholders to accelerate transformation.
Qualifications
Required Qualifications:
Bachelor's Degree in Supply Chain, Engineering, Data Analytics, Business Operations, Finance, or related field AND 8+ years experience in Data Science/Analytics, Engineering, Industrial Engineering, Supply Chain, Operations, or Project Management with a Supply Chain or Operations fieldOR Master's Degree in Supply Chain, Engineering, Data Analytics, Business Operations, Finance, or related field AND 8+ years experience in Data Science/Analytics, Engineering, or Project Management with a Supply Chain or Operations field
OR equivalent experience.
8+ years of experience in Commercial, Supply Chain, Process Improvement, Planning, Digital Transformation, or related organization.
Ability to lead, guide and coach project team members in areas such as supply chain planning, digital transformation, and SAP project implementation.
Ability to effectively design, gain alignment and successfully execute significant change initiatives from project start to finish.
Have experience collaborating with BI teams and building programs on Power BI and Power Platform
Lean Six Sigma certification is preferred.
Desired Characteristics:
Demonstrated ability to successfully manage large scale changes and influence in a matrixed organization.
Demonstrated strategic thinking and leadership with strong relationship management ability.
Displayed capacity to navigate ambiguity, leveraging available information to construct a highly probable planning scenario.
Prior experience in managing by influence across multiple teams/groups across an organization.
Proven track record for identifying risks and implementing mitigations successfully.
Strong communication skills, both written and verbal collaboration skills, clear and succinct delivery.
Data-oriented, analytical and detail oriented, capable of developing and using models for optimization purposes yet balanced with an ability to be able to step back from data to draw out the right business approach for conclusion.
Strong project management/process improvement skills, effectively evaluates information/data to make decisions; anticipates obstacles and develop plans to resolve issues; create actionable strategies and operational plans.
Demonstrated customer focus – evaluates decisions through the eyes of the customer and develops processes to deliver outcomes that meet corporate, operations and sourcing goals.

The Singapore Institute of Technology (SIT) is a public autonomous university and the third largest university by intake in Singapore. SIT’s mission is to innovate with industry, through an integrated applied learning and research approach, so as to contribute to the economy and society. Singapore is the small city with a big dream. We are home to the best talent and have the world’s highest per capital investment in science and technology.

We have an opening for Research Fellow or Research Engineer. The selected applicant is expected to lead and pursue high-quality research in applied artificial intelligence and sustainability that lead to publications in top-tier international conferences and journals, as well as real-world implementations. If interested, please send your resume including a cover letter, CV and a brief statement of your work undertaken in previous work.

Roles & Responsibilities
The Singtel Management Associate Programme (MAP) is an established two-year graduate programme that is designed to nurture our next generation of leaders. As Singtel grows in the digital space and lead in ICT innovations, we recognise the importance of having young talents who are passionate about technology to join us in delivering critical and impactful solutions to serve the needs of our customers.

Under the MAP, you can look forward to plenty of professional development opportunities that help to fast-track your career. This programme comprises of rotations across different business areas where you can find the best fit for your skills and interests. You will take on a range of challenging and impactful projects, develop your core competencies and receive direct guidance from our senior leaders.

You will be able to select any of the two MAP tracks based on your skills and career interests: MAP track (Business) and SMAP track (Tech).

As a Management Associate in the Business track, you would have exposure to rotations in (but not limited to) Corporate Functions, Marketing, Sales & Business Development, and Strategy & Consulting - where you would hone your business acumen and management skills as you work on challenging assignments and projects that will have a real impact on the business and lives of customers.

As a Specialist Management Associate in the Tech track, you would have the opportunity to apply your Computing or Engineering technical expertise as you take on rotations in specialised areas comprising (but not limited to) Data Science & Analytics, Network Engineering, Software Engineering & Development and IT & Cyber Security.

Roles & Responsibilities
Sales Executive

About CorDx:
CorDx is a multi-national biotech organization focused on pushing the limits of innovation and supply in global health. With over 2,000 employees across the world, serving millions of users in over 100 countries.
CorDx is transforming the global diagnostics industry with innovative R&D solutions, a vertically integrated supply chain, and manufacturing footprints in the United States and around the world.
With nearly two decades of IVD experience, CorDx is a leader in IVD research and development, manufacturing, and supply chain. Our proprietary line of rapid diagnostic products is recognized by families and medical professionals for reliability, affordability, and rapid results.
CorDx delivers rapid testing and point-of-care medical device solutions used in the detection of infectious disease such as COVID-19, pregnancy, drugs of abuse, biomarkers, and more. CorDx is at the cutting edge of technology, artificial intelligence, and data science with the goal of delivering diagnostic solutions to some of the most critical questions in healthcare.

Job Responsibilities
Build, develop and maintain good and close customer relationship with our business partners, especially the market key influencers such as academic and public institutions, hospitals, major clinic chains, pharmacies, dealers, agents, etc. with the aim to generate repeated sales & cultivating long-term, value-driven collaborations
Responsible for providing market feedback information and implementing the company's relevant sales strategies;
Responsible for establishing good customer relationships (including developing key customers) and maintaining good company image;
Excellent market sensitivity and able to quickly adapt to market changes;
Regularly summarize and analyze sales results, and submit relevant data, reports, etc.
Manage and generate response to queries from potential customers and follow-up on leads and referrals.
Work closely with the Sales team on sales plans to achieve or exceed the sales targets set by the Management through value creation selling activities.
Keep updated with product knowledge and stay informed of competitors’ products.
Provide accurate forecasts and pipeline data as well as market intelligence on competitors to the Management.
Develop and maintain an up-to-date customer list with contact details.
Lead and manage the sales team's KPIs, ensuring timely achievement of targets.
Collaborate with cross-functional leadership teams to synchronize business development goals with overall organizational objectives.
Any other ad-hoc duties or projects within the sales and marketing function as required by the management team.
Qualifications:
Strong network in medical device and pharmaceutical business.
A diploma with 2 years of relevant experience. Others are welcome to apply.
Familiar with in vitro diagnostic products such as lateral flow immunoassay, PCR, Immunoassay etc;
Familiar with IVD product development and commercialization life cycle;
Systematical project management, good planning, execution and timely communication. Good presentation skills.
Majoring in biology, medicine, laboratory science, immunology, pharmacy or quality engineering are preferred;
Enthusiastic, proactive, and down-to-earth work attitude, strong communication & execution ability, results driven, and a team player;

Be a Part of Something BIG!
This is a data scientist role in Advanced Analytics team to support Financial & Lifestyle Services (eg. Insurance) on activities related to data exploration, insights discovery, data model curation, campaign experimentation, machine learning model development and automated campaign design.
Make an Impact by:

Skills for Success

Your Career Growth Starts Here. Apply Now!

We are committed to a safe and healthy environment for our employees & customers and will require all prospective employees to be fully vaccinated.

Roles & Responsibilities
As a member of Team Central Provident Fund (CPF), you will play a crucial role in helping over 4 million members save for their retirement, healthcare, and housing needs as well as helping them cope with life’s uncertainties. With a fulfilling career, career growth, and development opportunities, you will be part of a big family of dedicated professionals. Join us and champion financial security for Singaporeans while leaving a lasting legacy.
What you will be working on
The Research and Analytics team deploys advanced data science methods to unlock the potential of data for the CPF Board. We are passionate about delivering value to internal customers, expanding our capabilities to push boundaries, and using data more pervasively in the Board. We are not confined to specific quantitative specialties and possess a variety of skillsets, from predictive analytics to econometrics and operations research. If you enjoy learning and applying diverse quantitative methods, look no further!
As a Research Analyst, you will drive new applications of data science through the novel use of established methods, as well as learn and apply new data science techniques. You will collaborate with diverse teams within the Board, ranging from scheme implementers to policymakers and corporate service providers, to translate their business needs into actionable data projects. Your primary objective will be to apply your expertise to assist in making data-driven decisions and enhancing the effectiveness of their processes. Your projects and insights will be presented to the Board's senior leadership and publicised throughout the Singapore Government.
Quantitative studies include, but are not confined to the following:
Conduct predictive analytics to automate manual processes, assess the retirement landscape, and perform more targeted outreach.
Utilise and customise large language models to streamline language-related processes such as correspondence routing and writing assistance.
Perform simulations and econometric studies to advance policy innovations aimed at improving the retirement adequacy of CPF members.
Analyse randomised controlled and natural experiments to enhance communication strategies with CPF members.
Utilise cluster analysis to identify groupings of CPF members for targeted policy and outreach interventions.
Optimise processes using methods such as operations research and reinforcement learning.
What we are looking for
Relevant experience in data analysis, research, or related field
Good statistical knowledge and proficiency in applying quantitative models.
Proficient in using quantitative methods from different disciplines will be a plus.
Proficient in statistical software such as Python, R, and Stata.
Ability to create engaging data visualisations, tell impactful data stories, and write in a concise yet compelling manner.
Enjoy building relationships with people from diverse job functions to understand and pre-empt their analytical needs.
Able to work independently to scope and drive own projects, demonstrating initiative and accountability.
Excellent problem-solving skills with a keen attention to detail.
What you can expect
A challenging and rewarding career
A variety of formal and informal training to enhance your skills in the evolving technology landscape
Promotion opportunities based on your capability and on-the-job performance
A friendly work environment with like-minded colleagues to co-create and collaborate together
A hybrid work model allowing remote work for up to 50% of the time, contingent upon the exigencies of service
A productive yet growth-oriented workplace with a flexible dress code empowering you to decide your appropriate outfit for the day
A comprehensive rewards package
Annual leave and pro-family leave
Medical and dental benefits
Access to recreational activities
Position is on a 1-year full-time contract directly under the payroll of CPF Board with an option to renew, contingent upon confirmation and subject to organisational needs. Additionally, there is potential for emplacement into a permanent position

job_title: Sr. Manager, Marketing Strategy and Analytics
job_description:
Roles & Responsibilities
See yourself at Twilio
Join the team as Twilio’s next Senior Manager, Marketing Strategy and Analytics, supporting the APJ region.
Who we are & why we’re hiring
Twilio powers real-time business communications and data solutions that help companies and developers worldwide build better applications and customer experiences.
Although we're headquartered in San Francisco, we have presence throughout South America, Europe, Asia and Australia. We're on a journey to becoming a global company that actively opposes racism and all forms of oppression and bias. At Twilio, we support diversity, equity & inclusion wherever we do business.
About the job
This position is needed to partner with APJ’s Marketing team on building out their strategic and analytical capabilities.
Focusing on our core sales-assisted and self-serve funnels, this person will fuel our continued growth by analyzing performance, spotting trends and recommending improvements across our marketing channels. This person will be pivotal in shaping our marketing direction with evidence-based decisions.
The right candidate has a mix of technical skills, business acumen and collaborative skills to identify and analyze ambiguous problems in a fast-paced environment.
Responsibilities
Analysis & Insight: Dive deep into marketing performance data across the APAC region, identifying trends, successes, and areas for improvement. Your analyses will form the backbone of our strategic marketing decisions, enabling us to sharpen our focus and optimize our approaches.
Strategic Guidance: Provide evidence-based recommendations to the VP of Marketing and the broader marketing organization. Your insights will inform adjustments in our marketing strategies, ensuring they are aligned with our regional revenue goals and broader company objectives.
Cross-functional Collaboration: Work closely with sales strategy and analytics, global marketing, and customer engagement teams to ensure a cohesive and integrated approach to market analysis and strategy implementation. As a bridge between data and strategy, your role will be pivotal in fostering internal solid partnerships.
Innovation & Optimisation: Champion using advanced analytics, marketing technologies, and data-driven insights to fuel innovation within our marketing practices. Your forward-thinking mindset will contribute to our continuous quest for excellence in customer engagement.
Reporting & Communication: Craft and deliver compelling presentations and reports that distill complex data into clear, actionable insights. Your ability to communicate effectively across different levels of the organization will ensure that insights lead to action.
Qualifications
Not all applicants will have skills that match a job description exactly. Twilio values diverse experiences in other industries, and we encourage everyone who meets the required qualifications to apply. While having “desired” qualifications make for a strong candidate, we encourage applicants with alternative experiences to also apply. If your career is just starting or hasn't followed a traditional path, don't let that stop you from considering Twilio. We are always looking for people who will bring something new to the table!
Required:
A minimum of 12+ years of experience in marketing analysis, performance strategy, or a related field, with a proven track record in a senior role.
Strong analytical skills, with expertise in marketing analytics tools and platforms. Familiarity with the digital marketing landscape in the APAC region is a must.
Exceptional communication skills can translate complex data sets into understandable and actionable insights for both technical and non-technical audiences.
A collaborative team player who thrives in cross-functional teams and is adept at building relationships across diverse groups.
Creative and strategic thinker with a passion for leveraging data to drive innovation and improvement in marketing practices.
Bachelor's degree in Marketing, Business, Statistics, or a related field. Advanced degrees or certifications in analytics, data science, or similar fields will be highly regarded.
Desired:
Management consulting experience preferred.
Location
This role will be remote, based in Singapore.
Travel
We prioritize connection and opportunities to build relationships with our customers and each other. For this role, you may be required to travel occasionally to participate in project or team in-person meetings.
What We Offer
There are many benefits to working at Twilio, including, in addition to competitive pay, things like generous time-off, ample parental and wellness leave, healthcare, a retirement savings program, and much more. Offerings vary by location.
Twilio thinks big. Do you?
We like to solve problems, take initiative, pitch in when needed, and are always up for trying new things. That's why we seek out colleagues who embody our values — something we call Twilio Magic. Additionally, we empower employees to build positive change in their communities by supporting their volunteering and donation efforts.
So, if you're ready to unleash your full potential, do your best work, and be the best version of yourself, apply now!
If this role isn't what you're looking for, please consider other open positions.

Location(s): Singapore / Kolkata India / Gurgaon India

Do you possess excellent problem solving abilities, programming skills and a passion for creating innovative applications?

Are you interested in working with one of the largest data repositories in the world today, soon to exceed 1 Exabyte?

Do you see yourself as an integral part of a highly skilled, multidisciplinary team solving hard data science problems through ground-breaking innovations and bringing them to real production ?

Do you feel comfortable in challenging problem solving environments where the issues confronting you often have no pre-set solutions, require first-principles thinking and need to be addressed on tight deadlines?

If you answered YES to the above, we have the ideal opportunity for you at Mobilewalla.

About Mobilewalla:

Mobilewalla stands as one of the world's fastest-growing consumer intelligence companies, headquartered in the United States and maintaining a global presence with offices across Europe, APAC, and ANZ regions.

Our innovative approach involves the development of cutting-edge computational techniques, ranging from semantic compression algorithms that enable cost-effective storage of vast datasets to statistical modeling techniques that profile anonymous consumers on their mobile devices. This innovation has led to the creation of the largest consumer audience platform in the mobile space. Mobilewalla's platform is rapidly becoming the preferred asset for global marketers seeking to execute data-driven marketing campaigns. We take pride in our technical excellence, having earned accolades such as the AWS Technology Company of the Year award in 2019.

Additionally, we have been recognized as a premier data company by Oracle Data Cloud, the world's largest digital data marketplace — a distinction shared by only 18 companies globally.

Responsibilities:

Advanced Analytics:
Develop and implement predictive models, algorithms, and statistical analyses to extract meaningful insights from large datasets specific to the Telco domain.
Design experiments and conduct exploratory data analysis to identify trends, patterns, and opportunities for product enhancement.
Machine Learning:
Apply machine learning techniques to optimize and personalize Telco product features.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to integrate machine learning models into our products, ensuring seamless user experiences.
Data Modelling:
Build and maintain robust data models (community detection) for Telco-specific datasets, considering scalability, efficiency, and accuracy.
Continuously evaluate and enhance existing models (Householding and Business Community detection) to improve predictive performance.
Product Enhancement:
Work closely with product managers to identify Telco market trends and customer needs, translating them into actionable data science projects.
Provide data-driven recommendations to improve product features, user engagement, and overall customer satisfaction.
Communication:
Effectively communicate complex analytical findings to both technical and non-technical stakeholders, facilitating informed decision-making.

Qualifications:

Educational Background:
Master's or Ph.D. in Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, or a related field.
Experience:
Proven track record of at least 4 years in a data science role with a focus on Telco competitive intelligence products.
Strong experience in applying machine learning algorithms and statistical modeling in the Telco domain.
Technical Skills:
Proficiency in programming languages such as Python or R.
Hands-on experience with relevant machine learning libraries (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch, PySpark) and data manipulation tools.
Domain Knowledge:
In-depth understanding of Telecommunications industry trends, challenges, and emerging technologies.
Familiarity with Telco-specific datasets and data sources.
Preferred Qualification:
Experience with Location Intelligence, including geospatial analytics, GIS tools, and the application of location-based data in Telco products.
Collaboration:
Proven ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams, including product management, engineering, and business stakeholders.
Communication Skills:
Excellent communication skills with the ability to present complex technical findings in a clear and understandable manner.
If you are a passionate & innovative problem solver with expertise in Telco products, we invite you to join our team and contribute to the success of our cutting-edge products in the telecommunications space.
For Singapore location : Individuals who are Singapore Citizens, Permanent Residents, or current Employment Pass (EP) holders only will be screened.

No agencies required.
