GMP Technologies (S) Pte Ltd | EA License: 11C3793 | EA Personnel: Bautista Gia Grace De Guzman | Registration No: R23111973

Roles & Responsibilities
About Us
MoneyHero Group (Nasdaq: MNY) is a market leading financial products platform in Greater Southeast Asia, reaching 9.8m monthly unique users and working with more than 270 commercial partners across five markets including Singapore, Hong Kong S.A.R., Philippines, Taiwan, and Malaysia.
What We Offer
You will be entitled to a competitive salary and attractive benefits, including:
Annual leave, birthday leave, tenure leave, international remote work leave, and more
Five-day work week, hybrid work arrangement
Professional trainings, career advancement and internal mobility opportunities
Competitive benefits including insurance and mental wellness program
About the Job
The Head of Data at MoneyHero Group is responsible for overseeing the collection, management, and storage of data across the organization. This role requires a strong understanding of data management principles, data platforms, data quality control, and the ability to provide insights and solutions leveraging advanced technologies such as conversational AI, NLP, and generative AI. The Head of Data will play a crucial role in establishing and maintaining an efficient and effective data landscape.
The Head of Data will be responsible for:
Enterprise Data Model: Establish and maintain an Enterprise Data Model that provides a comprehensive framework for organizing and structuring data across the organization.
Data Platform Management: Maintain and refresh the data platform and its underlying architecture to ensure scalability, reliability, and performance.
Data Quality Control: Establish data quality control programs to ensure data accuracy, consistency, and completeness. Implement processes and tools to identify and resolve data quality issues.
Reference Data Management: Develop solutions and processes for effective management of reference data, ensuring consistency and integrity across systems and applications.
Data Advisory: Provide expert advice and insights on data-related matters to stakeholders across the organization. Collaborate with business units to identify data-driven opportunities and recommend strategies for leveraging data effectively.
Reporting and Analytics: Enable both self-service and customized reporting capabilities, empowering users to access and analyze data efficiently. Collaborate with stakeholders to understand their reporting requirements and provide appropriate solutions.
Conversational AI and NLP Integration: Incorporate conversational AI and NLP technologies into the data landscape to enhance user experiences and facilitate future insights.
Partnership and Vendor Management: Participate in the selection of data platform architecture and prospective partners. Collaborate with vendors to ensure the successful implementation and integration of data-related solutions.
Data Security and Compliance: Work with the ISO to establish data management patterns for Personally Identifiable Information (PII), entitlements, and data classification. Ensure compliance with relevant data security regulations and best practices.
Offshore Team Support: Advise on best practices for data and report preparation for the offshore team. Provide guidance and support in developing effective data and reporting processes.
Key Activities (First 90 Days):
Establish an enterprise data model and a reference data management solution.
Participate in the selection of data platform architecture and provide requirements for prospective partners.
Work with the ISO to establish patterns for PII data management, entitlements, and data classification.
Advise on best practices for data and report preparation for the offshore team.
Key Activities (90 - 180 Days):
Finalize the business data dictionary and visualization layer.
Make decisions around the data platform and select a partner for data visualization.
Establish a data quality framework and IT controls framework for data reconciliation.
Key Activities (180 - 240 Days):
Drive faster time to insights by leveraging existing and upcoming data sources.
Develop a real-time predictive dashboard for revenue projection.
Automate group Key Performance Indicator (KPI) reports.
Establish lifecycle marketing patterns and practices, including self-service segmentation and exploratory/experimental segmentation.
In this role, we are looking for someone with:
Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Information Systems, or a related field.
Strong experience in data management, data platforms, and data architecture.
Proficiency in implementing data quality control programs and establishing data governance frameworks.
Experience with conversational AI, NLP, and generative AI technologies is highly desirable.
Knowledge of data security and compliance regulations (e.g., GDPR, CCPA) and best practices.
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.
Strong communication and interpersonal skills to effectively collaborate with stakeholders at all levels.
Ability to lead and manage a team of data analysts

Roles & Responsibilities
Hendricks Corp Pte Ltd is one of the leaders in Video Analytics that provide a range of solutions for multiple clients coming from Government, Security, Entertainment, Hospitality, etc.

We are looking for candidates to fulfil a role in AI Team as Engineer/ Senior Engineer. He/ She will be part of a dynamic team involved in deploying state-of-the-art computer vision, machine-learning and big data analytics solutions.
He / She will be managing a group of AI engineer and working closely with Product Manager, and report directly to VP of Technology/Application.
WHAT YOU WILL BE WORKING ON
Ensure timely delivery of projects within the committed schedule and budget ensuring project issues are timely resolved or escalated to management for attention.
Provide regular update to the lead engineer and lead project manager on the project progress highlighting project milestones, issues and track project expenditure.
Effectively engage and manage all relevant stakeholders to deliver systems.
Identify, manage project risks and implications to the project and to recommend mitigating measures.
Understand the various prevailing policies and security guidelines and to ensure the system and processes are designed to comply with these policies and guidelines.
Ensure proper integration and testing of all hardware and software components so the system is delivered according to contractual requirements.
Depending on candidate’s suitability, he/ she can be tasked with one or more of the following secondary accountabilities:
Build data ingesting and processing pipelines to collect, clean, harmonise, merge and consolidate data sources to be used for analysis, machine learning and visualisation purposes.
Ensure data quality.
Collaborate with various teams to understand needs to build scalable and data-driven products and assist with data-related technical issues.
Participate in the application of machine learning/AI techniques to various problem statements.
Ability to simplify ideas, present and engage stake holders and senior management.
Keep abreast of technological advances in Big Data Technologies, Computer Vision and government policies & recommendations, etc.
WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR
Tertiary qualification in computer science, electrical engineering, information systems, data science, mathematics, statistics, or other quantitative/ analytical fields. Applicants with postgraduate qualifications and/or more than 5 years of experience working in the relevant technology domains will be considered for senior positions.
Good project management skills
Proficiency in the following:
Software Development / Engineering
Operating in agile, SCRUM product development environments.
Machine Learning and Artificial intelligence
Computer Vision and Video Analytics
Proficient in ML/AI scripting languages (Python, R)
Knowledge and experience on SaaS development is a plus
He / She has
Good critical thinking, data analysis and problem-solving skills
Good written and verbal communication skills
Good interpersonal and stakeholder management skills
Ability to work under tight timelines.

job_title: Senior Executive / Assistant Manager, Data Analytics & Insights Group Care Plan Operations
job_description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Data Analytics & Insights (DAI) team under Group Care Plan Ops will support and work in close partnership with NUHS senior management, Group Specialty Chiefs (GSCs), Management Decision Support (MDS) teams and other stakeholders to realise the delivery of One Specialty, Multiple Sites and a OneNUHS patient care philosophy. The DAI team will develop innovative analytics solutions and derive actionable insights to support management decision making towards attainment of the healthcare vision and key priorities.

Responsibilities
Identify data and information needs required to enable the vision and key priorities of the organisation.
Collaborate with stakeholders to identify available and relevant datasets and make strategic recommendations on such collection, integration and usage.
Develop, maintain and refine interactive dashboards using data visualisation tools such as Tableau.
To assist in developing the timeline that will enable DAI to progressively meet stakeholder needs.
Establish and prioritise dashboard and scorecard of key stakeholders and working collaboratively with Group Clinical Ops and Group Service Ops, to refresh the Dashboard and Scorecards on an ongoing basis.
To be well versed with and keep updated on Epic and other operational applications in order to propose solutions that will address group operations management and senior management needs on operational excellence.
Requirements
Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Information Management, Mathematics, Statistics, Operations Research, Engineering or related disciplines with strong statistical modelling and machine learning skills.
At least 3 years of relevant working experience with analytics tools e.g. SQL, Python, MS Excel (advanced), data visualisation tools (e.g. Tableau)
Familiarity with healthcare setting is a plus.
Fresh graduates with excellent data capabilities will be considered.
Excellent interpxersonal skills, attention to detail, and flexibility to collaborate across various team areas and functions.
Possess can-do attitude and work independently in ambiguous situations.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Proficient in extracting, cleansing, and interpreting complex data with attention to detail and accuracy.
Able to communicate sophisticated data science concepts clearly through concise reports and presentations, effectively conveying observations and recommendations.

Roles & Responsibilities
The Risk Officer will work in close collaboration with traders, operations, trade support, accounting, and back office. This role is a key control function ensuring quality reporting of trading performance and risk analysis for the region.

Main Responsibilities
Daily trading P&L validation and reporting to traders and management. This includes analysis of the key drivers of P&L and reconciliation against trader's estimates and market fundamentals.
Daily exposure reconciliation with traders
Liaise and coordinate daily with operations for logistical impact on risk exposure and P&L/costs.
Daily reconciliation of listed derivative contracts between exchange statements and in-house ETRM systems.
Daily validation of trade economics of physical trades done against trade recaps.
Ensure curves are reasonably marked by comparing against broker quotes/reliable external sources.
Check marked to market curves applied to physical deal valuation daily.
Allocate hedges in strategies.
Monitor daily VAR consumption against VAR limits and report breaches to Head of Risk, Asia Pacific on a timely basis.
Responsible for reviewing, investigation and resolution of month end breaks between in-house ETRM system trading results and accounting.
Responsible for setting up new curves/calendar set up and onboarding new products to be traded in-house ETRM system for risk management and P&L generation.
Will be expected to participate and contribute to any system and process migration projects relating to Risk function.
Perform cross coverage within Risk team.
Identify and implement ways to streamline existing processes such as automation.
Provide risk analytics for management reporting.
Ad-hoc duties as assigned by manager.
Job Qualifications
Degree with a major in, Accountancy, Business Administration, Business Analytics, Data Science, Economics, Finance, Mathematics. Polytechnic or diploma holder qualifications with relevant experience.
Minimum 2 or more years’ work experience in the trading/commodities houses as Risk Officer (or equivalent) for both derivatives and physical trades.
Has manual technical skills and able to calculate risk, VAR, P&L Manually if required, to spot errors.
Proficient in Excel.
Excellent preference for Excel VBA, Python or Power Query/BI skills.
Able to work under pressure in dynamic environment.
We respect your privacy and all communication will be treated with confidentiality. If you wish to know more about this position or explore other roles, please prepare your updated profile and get in touch with carolyn.mendoza@manpower.com.sg | Personnel Reg No.: R1105160 | EA License: 02C3423

Please note that your response to this advertisement and communications with us pursuant to this advertisement will constitute informed consent to the collection, use and/or disclosure of personal data by Manpower for the purpose of carrying out its business, in compliance with the relevant provisions of the Personal Data Protection Act 2012. To learn more about ManpowerGroup's Global Privacy Policy, please visit https://www.manpower.com.sg/privacy-policy

Roles & Responsibilities
The Senior Research Engineer are expected to think critically and creatively in applying artificial intelligence knowledge to design and develop innovative algorithms, systems and solutions. He/She will work closely with other researchers in the design new technology solutions as well as to complement existing technology areas. With strong research background and analytical skills, the Research engineers are expected to apply research results to developing cutting-edge technologies critical to our client’s vision of being a world-class leader in audio AI research and innovation.

Responsibilities:
Work on cutting-edge research and development in one of the following areas: audio / speech recognition, natural language processing, computer vision.
Design, develop and implement deep/machine learning algorithms.
Process and experiment with real-world data for effective solutions.
Optimise deep/machine learning algorithms for efficiency and scalability.

Relevant Qualifications and Experiences
PhD or Masters Degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Engineering or Audio related fields.
Solid knowledge in one or more of the following fields: computer vision, natural language processing, audio & speech, or other deep/machine learning technologies.
Strong analytical skills with ability to learn and apply research theories into developing algorithms to solve real world problems.
Proficient in Python, and relevant data science libraries.
Experience with at least one deep learning framework, such as PyTorch, TensorFlow etc.
Experience in C/C++
Working experience in deep/machine learning technologies.
Publications in the fields of computer vision, natural language processing, audio & speech, or other deep/machine learning.

The above information on this description has been designed to indicate the general nature, and level, of the work performed by this position. It is not designed to contain, or be interpreted, as a comprehensive inventory of all duties, responsibilities and qualifications required.

Interested candidates may also apply or write in to CS Chua, EA 12C6130/ R1548619 cschua@hpspartners.com.sg. Shortlisted candidates will be contacted for a discussion.

Roles & Responsibilities
Responsibilities:

The DQ LAB in associated with the DQ Institute is seeking an experienced ERD to join its international team. We are looking for a senior researcher who can bring their talents to contribute to the evaluation and accreditation of digital literacy educational programs. This exciting project will involve partnership work with large scale international organizations such as the international telecommunications union (ITU), IEEE, UNICEF, UNESCO, and others.

As ERD, you will bring enthusiasm, energy, and passion to your work on issues at the forefront of education and technology. Our team values problem solving, analytical and statistical skills. Our ideal candidates are smart, creative, analytical thinkers with attention to detail.

The ERD will take the lead on a scheme where the DQ LAB evaluate and accredit the educational content of partners and clients. You will manage relationships with international partners including governments, NGOs, schools, universities, and private companies. Moreover, you will study their educational materials, evaluate their alignment with DQ Global Standards and produce on-/off-line reports and presentations while working alongside our partner organizations.

You will be part of an international team working closely with colleagues from research, data science, and IT development. In addition, you will work closely with partners and advisors who work at the cutting edge in the fields of psychology, education, and media research. You will engage with partners from globally renowned NGOs and social enterprises as well as figures from national and local government.

RESPONSIBILITIES
Lead the development and execution of research and development projects.
Plan, initiate and lead research, client presentations, workshops, and discussions.
Use critical thinking techniques to move thoughts and discussions from broad to specific.
Help define specific product features by integrating inputs from a wide range of sources including qualitative and quantitative research.
Influence the direction and quality of work via thought leadership and mentoring.
Lead development of curriculums, frameworks, assessments, and educational content.
Lead alignment and mapping process of external education content according to the DQ Framework.
Direct and manage a team of researchers and data scientists.
Lead development and writing of research papers, articles, and blogs.
Work with creative and tech teams to deliver assessments and education products/services.
Develop and work with a Research Committee.

Typical Skills and Experiences:

Education: Graduate degree (master’s degree, or PhD) in, psychometrics, psychology, human-computer interaction, education, communications or related field preferred.

Experience: Typically, five or more years of research experience.


Knowledge, Abilities and Skills:
Must
· Experience in tests and measurement
· Experience in questionnaire design
· Be able to lead a research team composed of multi-disciplinary researchers
· Develop a research strategy and support the strategic direction
· Be able to understand statistics and to communicate with data scientists
· Translate science to educators and policy makers
· Be able to adapt a dynamically changing environment
· Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
Preferred
· Proven project management skills; ability to perform well on multiple concurrent projects and meet timelines.
· Can provide leadership for all aspects of the design process, as well as areas outside field of expertise
· Exceptional theoretical and practical knowledge in the conception of studies and questionnaires
· Strong research assessment and analytical skills
· Clear user experience design focus; proven familiarity with emerging technologies and the ability to integrate new technologies to user experience designs.
· Strong interpersonal skills; ability to work effectively independently and as part of a team.
· Proven problem-solving skills

Benefits
· Employee Benefits
o Annual Leave
- 14 days annual leave first full year (prorated if full year not completed)
- Maximum of 11 days carryover to next year or cash out annually
o Sick Leave
o Bonus at the discretion of company
o AWS 1 month pay
· Additional Singaporean Employee Benefits
o CPF
o Full Health Insurance
· Non-Singaporean Employee Benefits
o Health Insurance Stipend

About the DQ Institute
https://www.dqinstitute.org/
The DQ Institute (DQI) is an international think-tank that is dedicated to setting global standards for digital intelligence education, outreach, and policies. Working together with international agencies and local partners, DQI builds multi-stakeholder coalitions that advance its mission and help people worldwide. It is registered as a 501(C)(3) not-for-profit charity organization in the US. Its affiliated organizations are DQ Lab Pte Ltd, a global social enterprise based in Singapore and as well as Ahn-Sei Foundation infollutionZERO, a not-for-profit foundation in Korea.

Roles & Responsibilities
Mandatory Skills: SAS Viya

Job scopes:
Design and implement relevant data models in the form of data marts stored in Operational Data Stores, Data Warehouses or Big Data platforms
Build data pipelines to bring information from source systems, harmonise and cleanse data to support analytics initiatives for core business metrics and performance trends.
Perform data profiling to understand data quality and advise practical measures to address such data issues through data transformation and data loading
Dive into company data to identify sources and features that will drive business objectives.
Work closely with project manager and technical leads to provide regular status reporting and support them to refine issues/problem statements and propose/evaluate relevant analytics solutions
Bring your experience and ideas to effective and innovative engineering, design and strategy
Work in interdisciplinary teams that combine technical, business and data science competencies that deliver work in waterfall or agile software development lifecycle methodologies
The range of accountability, responsibility and autonomy will depend on your experience and seniority, including:
Contributing to our internal networks and special interest groups
Mentoring to upskill peers and juniors, guiding the SAS interns of the team
Requirement:

Possess good communications skills to understand our customers' core business objectives and build end-to-end data centric solutions to address them
Good critical thinking and problem-solving abilities
3 years of relevant IT software experience relating to data integration/ETL and data warehousing implementation. Experience needs to include data mapping, ETL development and testing.
Mininum 2 years development experience with implementing ETL solution in SAS Data Integrator.
Has knowledge in Windows and Unix environments
Ability to be flexible enough to work for extended hours and on weekends as needed to handle high priority issues, production recoveries, provide support to infrastructure releases.
Possesses excellent communication skills and demonstrates ability to communicate effectively with both technical and non-technical individuals.
Good Team Player, quick learner and self-starter who requires minimal supervision
Experience with other aspects of data management such as data governance, metadata management, archival, data lifecycle management
Large scale data loading experience moving enterprise or operational data from source systemsto new applications or data analytics solutions
Familiar with other Big Data platforms and/or other ETL tools and products on the market
Hands-on experience for other SAS Tools will be an added advantage:
o SAS Enterprise Miner
o SAS Enterprise Guide
o SAS Visual Analytics
o SAS Viya

Roles & Responsibilities
The National Institute of Education (Nanyang Technological University, Singapore) invites suitable applications for the position of Research Associate on a 12 month contract at the Centre for Research in Child Development (CRCD), Office of Education Research (OER).

Project Title: Beginning Early: SingaPore’s Ongoing Study starting in Infancy of Twenty-first-century-skills, Individual differences, and Variance in the Environment (BE POSITIVE study)

Project Introduction: The Centre for Research in Child Development (CRCD) at National Institute of Education (NIE) is looking for a Research Associate to assist with the BE POSITIVE study.

Beginning Early: SingaPore’s Ongoing Study starting in Infancy of Twenty-first-century-skills, Individual differences, and Variance in the Environment (BE POSITIVE study) is a collaboration with Singhealth Polyclinics and involves more than 14 research scientists and clinicians. As such, the Research Associate will have the opportunity to interact with people from a variety of backgrounds, and will also work closely with the overall study PI. BE POSITIVE’s primary goal is to better examine the interaction between home and school influences upon child development and academic success, starting in ages 0-4. Data sources will include computerized testing, questionnaires, and video/audio data.

Requirements
We are looking for an organized and responsible Research Associate to support project management and data organization and analysis. The Research Associate may have opportunities for manuscript writing should he/she wish.
• Academic qualification: Masters in Psychology, Neuroscience, Social Work, Nursing, Data Science, or related field. Candidates with a PhD may be considered for a Research Fellow position instead.
• Ability to communicate, read, and write in English
• Ability to think logically with regards to data organization and advise staff on management
• Work experience: Past experience with project management is a plus
• Desirable interests, skills, and attributes:
• Interest in cognitive and developmental outcomes and parent-child interactions
• Detail oriented, ability to work in a team, organized.

Responsibilities
Assist PI with project management (e.g., staff management, budgeting, reporting (including analysis), purchasing, IRB development, documentation), manage data cleaning and storage team, ensure communication between team members, contribute to development of the project where needed, as well as tracking the recruitment and outcomes. There may also be opportunities for manuscript writing.

Application
Applicants (external and internal) will apply via Workday. We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

Workday Job Requisition ID: R00015961
(https://ntu.wd3.myworkdayjobs.com/Careers/job/NTU-Main-Campus-Singapore/Research-Fellow--Centre-for-Research-in-Child-Development--Office-of-Education-Research---NIE-_R00015961)

job_title: Research Associate (Centre for Research in Health Systems Performance)
job_description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Interested applicants are invited to apply directly at the NUS Career Portal.
Your application will be processed only if you apply via NUS Career Portal.

We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

Job Description
The National University of Singapore invites applications for Research Associate in Health Services and Data Science (Project: Development of Natural Language Processing and Item response Theory based systems for Patient Reported Outcome Measurement) in the Centre for Research in Health Systems Performance, Yong Loo Lin School of Medicine.

Optimizing the performance of health systems is essential to ensuring the wellbeing and longevity of populations worldwide. Singapore is particularly well placed to lead research in this field as its health system has been consistently ranked as one of the best in the world based in independent evaluation with the Global Burden of Disease data. The new Centre for Research in Health Systems Performance (CRiHSP) aims to advance research in this area within the Yon Loo Lin School of Medicine of the National University of Singapore (NUS) as the leading centre for research in health systems in Asia. CRiHSP will be composed of a multidisciplinary team of researchers in health systems (health services and policy researchers, data scientists, social scientists, and others), and administrators. It will provide an exciting and dynamic place in which people of diverse backgrounds collaborate towards the common goal of achieving excellence in Health Systems Research.

CRiHSP is collaborating with the Department of Family Medicine (DFM) at NUHS, which was established in 2017 with the aim of supporting the Division of Family Medicine within the Yon Loo Lin School of Medicine of the National University of Singapore (NUS). DFM’s multidisciplinary team of clinicians, researcher, medical educators, and administrators works towards the common goals of achieving achieve excellence in Family Medicine education, research and practice. CRiHSP and DFM also benefit from a significant expansion in related fields and collaborations with the new Centre for Sustainable Medicine (CoSM) and the Centre for Behavioural and Implementation Sciences Interventions (BISI) at the School of Medicine and the Saw See Hock School of Public Health.
Job Description
NUS offers highly competitive remuneration packages. The successful applicant will be offered an annual salary plus benefits commensurate with his or her qualifications, experience and expertise and will have access to travel support to disseminate research outcomes at international academic conferences.
The position is full-time for 1 year in the first instance, depending on project commitments and candidate’s career objectives. Start date is flexible, with the position expected to commence in the first half of 2024.
Purpose of the Post
CRiHSP is hiring a highly motivated and skilled Research Associate to contribute to a research project employing mixed-methods for the development of methods for measuring patient reported outcome measures in the population of Singapore based on the efficient application of Natural Language Processing and Item Response Theory to existing measurement systems working under the project Principal Investigator (PI), CRiHSP Director, Prof Jose M Valderas. The successful candidate will report the Senior Research Fellow responsible for the project. The role provides a rare opportunity to work at the centre of this rapidly evolving field, shaping the future of healthcare and clinical practice.
Main Duties and Responsibilities
The Research Associate will have the following duties:
Contribution to the management of research activities including grant and IRB/DSRB applications, budgeting, planning and monitoring project timelines and generally support project management and coordination and liasing with internal and external stakeholders
Conduct literature reviews, including collation and synthesis of the literature
Support the design and interpretation of quantitative surveys and qualitative interviews and focus groups and collect data
Contribute to and lead (where appropriate) protocol, manuscript and report timely writing, editing and submission.
Present work for feedback and dissemination at workshops or conferences locally and/or internationally
The post holder will be expected to be flexible in their role as the CRiHSP´s capacity evolves.
Qualifications
Applicants will be evaluated based on the following selection criteria:

Qualifications
Masters in Life Sciences, Health & Social Sciences
Experience
Experience in planning, managing and implementing healthcare-related research projects, from conception to completion, in a University setting (essential).Track record of publishing in international peer-reviewed journals (desirable)
Demonstrated experience in Natural Language Processing (NLP) and/or Item Response Theory (IRT) methods , or programming languages such as R, Python (desirable)
Researchers with existing research activities related to developing and using computerized adaptive (CAT) methods are particularly encouraged to apply.
Qualifications
Skills and Personal Attributes:
Strong communication skills in English, both written and spoken (essential)
Ability to work independently and as part of a multidisciplinary team (essential)
Highly developed problem-solving skills and adept at managing complex problems (essential)
Outcome-orientation with excellent organizational and project management skills, and attention to detail (essential)
Ability to work with culturally diverse populations (essential)
Application
Remuneration will be commensurate with the candidate’s qualifications and experience. Informal enquiries are welcome and should be made to Prof Jose M Valderas at jmvalderas@nus.edu.sg.

Formal application: Please submit your application, indicating current/expected salary, supported by a detailed CV (including personal particulars, academic and employment history, complete list of publications/oral presentations and full contacts of three (3) referees) as well as a cover letter outlining their motivation and suitability for the project addressing each of the criteria outlined above.

Roles & Responsibilities
The Innovation & Enterprise Fellowship Programme (IFP) seeks to grow the pool of deep-tech talent in Singapore with the capabilities to support the commercialisation of deep-tech research and bring nascent technologies to market. Targeting researchers, scientists, and engineers (RSEs), the programme aims to develop industry relevant innovation and entrepreneurial skills through both formal and on-the-job training.
At EDDC, as Singapore’s national platform for drug discovery and development. We are committed to discover and develop novel therapeutics by working collaboratively with both public sector and industry partners to translate innovations from bench to clinic using industry relevant and cutting-edge technology platforms. This includes tackling complex and unmet medical challenges in disease areas such as oncology, fibrosis, infectious and autoimmune diseases. EDDC is now seeking under the IFP programme a highly skilled and motivated Bioinformatics Scientist/Engineer to join the Computational Biology group to drive data-driven discovery of therapeutic targets and clinically relevant biomarkers, achieving wholistic understanding of human disease biology and pathology.
This is an eighteen months on-the-job training programme that requires participation in and supporting cross-functional and collaborative drug discovery projects. By joining EDDC, the IFP candidate will be part of a dynamic, interdisciplinary team geared to enhance and facilitate the drug discovery journey through data harmonization and deconvolution, multimodal data analytics, and advanced machine learning. The role will also leverage strategic partnerships both locally and globally, to adopt a flexible approach in refining and advancing EDDC’s solutions.
Responsibilities:
1. Multimodal data analytics for target, biomarker discovery and MoA elucidation
o Develop and implement computational strategies for integrated analysis across diverse biological datasets, including but not limited to genetics/genomics, transcriptomics (bulk- and single-cell RNAseq) and proteomics data.o Employ state-of-the-art machine learning and AI techniques to uncover patterns in extensive biological datasets, developing predictive models that inform therapeutic strategies.o Collaborate with cross-functional colleagues to drive the data-driven discovery and prioritization of novel therapeutic targets and clinically relevant biomarkers, integrating advanced analytics to elucidate the molecular mechanisms of action.
2. Data Integration and automation
o Evaluate and harmonize multi-dimensional data to ensure data quality and consistency.
o Architect and manage databases for cross-functional biological data from public and proprietary sources.
o Optimise and automate workflows when applicable, streamline data access for researchers to facilitate high-throughput analysis and collaborative research efforts.
3. Collaborative Research and strategic partnerships
o Work closely with experimental biologists, chemists, and other computational biologists to design experiments, analyse results, and communicate findings in scientific reports and presentations.
o Establish and maintain partnerships with leading computational biology, data science, and AI entities both locally and globally, serving as the computational biology liaison to ensure effective communication and alignment of objectives between external partners and EDDC’s internal project teams.
4. Innovation and Continuous Learning
o Stay abreast of the latest developments in bioinformatics, data science, machine learning, and AI as they pertain to drug discovery and development.
o Implement new technologies and methodologies to refine in-house workflows and enhance EDDC’s computational platforms.
Requirements:
PhD in Computational Biology, Bioinformatics, Computer Science, or a related field, with a strong emphasis on data analytics and machine learning in biological contexts. Minimally 5 years of postdoc experience or equivalent in industry settings.
Applicants with suitable aptitude, potential and interest in harnessing big-data and advanced analytics for enhancing and accelerating drug discovery.
Demonstrated experience in multi-omics data analysis (eg. genetics/genomics, bulk and single-cell transcriptomics, proteomics, etc.) and the application of machine learning in biological research.
Proficiency in software engineering and programming languages such as Python and R, and familiarity with data engineering techniques including cloud-based and on-premises database services, database management systems, APIs and workflow development frameworks.
Excellent communication and collaboration skills, with experience working independently and in multi-disciplinary teams.
Keen to learn new techniques and adaptable to changing priorities.
Proficiency in machine learning and AI methodologies for analysing large-scale biological data, with a proven track record of developing predictive models to guide therapeutic development and strategy is an advantage.
Industry experience in pharmaceutical or biotech companies is an advantage.
The above eligibility criteria are not exhaustive. A*STAR may include additional selection criteria based on its prevailing recruitment policies. These policies may be amended from time to time without notice. We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

Roles & Responsibilities
Job Description:
Support the production of scalable and optimised AI or machine learning (ML) models.
Focus on building algorithms for the extraction, transformation and loading of large volumes of real-time, unstructured data to deploy AI or ML solutions from theoretical data science models.
Run experiments to test the performance of deployed models, and identifies and resolves bugs that arise in the process.
Work in a team setting and apply knowledge in statistics, scripting and programming languages required by the firm.
Work with the relevant software platforms in which the models are deployed.
Requirements:

Roles & Responsibilities
Driven by the passion to improve quality of people’s lives, WS Audiology continues to grow as market leader in the hearing aid industry. With our commitment to increase penetration in an underserved hearing care market, we want to accelerate our business transformation in order to reach more people, more effectively.
We are seeking a well-rounded data engineer to join our team. As part of the Global Post Market Quality and Data Analytics team, you will play an integral role in processing consumer feedback through data quality assurance, data modelling, data integration and automation. Under a diverse team, you will have a plethora of opportunities to work cross-culturally and cross-functionally to streamline data processes.
What you will do
Build and maintain data pipelines for efficient data movement. Use ETL processes to extract and store data from various sources and transform it into a clean and usable format.
Develop and implement data models to support business intelligence, reporting and analytics requirements.
Integrate data from different sources (internal/external) to provide a unified and comprehensive view of the data.
Implement data quality checks and validation processes to ensure the accuracy and reliability of the data. Identify and address data quality issues.
Write scripts and use automation tools to streamline data processes and workflows.
Collaborate with stakeholders within and outside of the team to understand data needs and streamline data.

Experience
Bachelor's degree in Data science, Computer Engineering, Computing, IT or any other related field.
3+ years of relevant working experience in data roles.

Familiarity with integrating data sets from various systems, identifying gaps and presenting visualized data using Power BI.
Able to handle structured data from various sources and formats (e.g.: from customers and operations), such as complaints and returns.
Basic knowledge in quality processes (medical device industry) is a plus.
Personal competencies
Great team player and good communicator. Able to break down complex concepts in a simple and clear manner.
Responsible with a good sense of urgency.
Who we are
At WS Audiology, we provide innovative hearing aids and hearing health services.
Together with our 12,000 colleagues in 130 countries, we invite you to help unlock human potential by bringing back hearing for millions of people around the world.
With us, you will become part of a truly global company where we care for one another, welcome diversity and celebrate our successes.
Sounds wonderful? We can't wait to hear from you.
WS Audiology is an equal-opportunity employer and committed to creating an inclusive employee experience for all. Regardless of race, color, religion, national origin, age, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, marital status, medical condition, ancestry, disability, military or veteran status we firmly believe that our work is at its best when everyone feels free to be their most authentic self.

company_name: LOUIS DREYFUS COMPANY ASIA PTE. LTD.
job_description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Overview / Brief
Louis Dreyfus Company is a leading merchant and processor of agricultural goods. Our activities span the entire value chain from farm to fork, across a broad range of business lines, we leverage our global reach and extensive asset network to serve our customers and consumers around the world. Structured as a matrix organization of six geographical regions and ten platforms, Louis Dreyfus Company is active in over 100 countries and employs approximately 15,000 people globally.

Central to our global commodity processing and trading activities, the Ocean Freight Platform has grown to become a major global chartering entity. The candidate will sit on the Freight trading desk and will enjoy project responsibility, exposure to senior traders, and strong support from managers. You will be working in a research team with other analysts and data scientists. You will be able to leverage LDC data science stack, with proprietary python packages and databases.

Diversity & Inclusion
LDC is driven by a set of shared values and high ethical standards
Diversity is part of our DNA. LDC strives to create a diverse and inclusive work environment where people can thrive regardless of gender, sexuality, ethnicity or background.

Sustainability
Sustainable value is at the heart of our purpose as a company
We are passionate about creating fair and sustainable value, both for our business and for other value chain stakeholders: our people, our business partners, the communities we touch and the environment around us.

Main Responsibilities:
Monitoring and forecasting the supply and demand dynamics of the global iron ore and steel markets, as well as the key drivers and risks affecting them.
Providing timely and insightful analysis and commentary on the iron ore and steel market developments, trends and outlooks
Developing and maintaining quantitative models and databases to support the iron ore and steel market analysis and forecasting.
Collaborating with other analysts across different commodities and regions to ensure a consistent and integrated view of the commodity markets.
Contributing to the development and improvement of the research products, methodologies, and tools.
Experiences:
At least 3 years of relevant experience research or trading, preferably in a commodity trading house, consultancy, or financial institution.
A strong understanding of the iron ore and steel market fundamentals, drivers, and dynamics, as well as their impact on the dry bulk market.
Excellent analytical, quantitative, and problem-solving skills, with attention to detail and accuracy.
Excellent communication, presentation, and interpersonal skills, with the ability to work independently and as part of a team.
Other skills (Computer Skills, etc)
Proficient in Excel, PowerPoint, and other data analysis tools.
Skillful in Python.
Languages:
English (Fluent)
Ability to read and write Mandarin would be an added advantage
Academics
Degree in Economics, Finance, Engineering or related field of study

Roles & Responsibilities
Job Purpose
BBC Global Media & Streaming, a division of BBC Studios is seeking a Data and Insights Executive to support the Integrated Marketing team of the Ad sales group in Asia-Pacific. The role’s key responsibilities include supporting the Advertising Sales team to meet Ad Revenue goals, by providing data/insight support for various business teams. The Advertising Sales team is responsible for sales across BBC owned platforms, including BBC.com, BBC News (TV), BBC Earth , Top Gear, BBC World Service Languages, and BBC social media.

Key Responsibilities and Accountabilities
Act as an insight expert across the commercial portfolios within BBC Studios, and use data/insights to form strategic narratives for Ad Sales business
Act as primary contact for ad sales requests, providing data to assist media planning process and respond to RFPs in Ad Sales client pitches
Act as primary contact to track BBC commercial performance and produce dashboards, performance packs as appropriate, presenting in a compelling way telling the story behind the data
Assist Head of Data & Insights, APAC in the planning, executing and delivering strategic, operational and tactical research projects and supervise them from start to finish. These may include advertising campaigns, sector specific research projects
Assist Head of Data & Insights, APAC in supervising external research agency and vendors for ad hoc projects to deliver timely and successful outcome under allocated budget
Work along-side Integrated Marketing team and Ad Sales team to prepare data/insight-backed brief responses
Provide basic research training to new members of various teams so that they understand key research metrics, methodologies and our key positioning points.

Knowledge, Skills, Training & Experience
Market Research Experience
Professional experience in campaign/advertising effectiveness research is required preferably from media or research agency
Good understanding of traditional market research techniques, SPSS/statistical analysis and panel methodologies
Knowledge in neuroscience techniques and cross media attribution is a plus
Ability to work with external vendors to set-up online surveys and craft survey questions effectively to answer business objectives
Ability to generate analyses to enable the data interpretation and insights gathering
Ability to identify appropriate narratives from syndicated or bespoke survey data sources
Digital Media Experience
Basic knowledge in digital analytics tools such as Google Analytics, Piano, Adobe, etc.
Experience with data science is a plus
Basic knowledge of ad operations and how the digital advertising ecosystem works is a plus
Ability to analyse and interpret digital data and identify noteworthy trends for business and editorial purposes
Personal Attributes
An appreciation of international news and streaming business
Ability to influence and manage stakeholders across various functions
Advanced proficiency with Excel and PowerPoint is essential
Ability to manage projects independently
Self-motivated, deadline-driven, ability to support multiple projects at a time
Effective communication skills - both written and oral; comfortable presenting at meetings
High comfort level in dealing with big datasets and linking/merging of data streams
Attention to details is a must
Competencies
Analytical thinking - able to simplify complex problems, processes or projects into component parts explore and evaluate them systematically.
Planning and organisation - able to think ahead in order to establish and efficient and appropriate course of action for self and others. Prioritises and plans activities taking into account all the relevant issues and factors such as deadlines and resources.
Managing relationships - able to build and maintain effective working relationships with a range of people. Works co-operatively with others to be part of a team, as opposed to working separately or competitively.
Influencing and persuading - able to present sound and well reasoned arguments to convince others. Can draw from a range of strategies to persuade people in a way that results in agreement or behaviour change.
Communication – actively listens and adapts communication style to the audience being addressed.
Flexibility - adapts and works effectively with a variety of situations, individuals or groups. Able to understand and appreciate different and opposing perspectives on an issue, to adapt an approach as the requirements of a situation change, and to change or easily accept changes in one’s own organisation or job requirements.

company_name: NATIONAL CANCER CENTRE OF SINGAPORE PTE LTD
job_description:
Roles & Responsibilities
The Data Scientist role is to help the team in driving and maintaining a shared platform for clinical and genomic data recording and analysis, as well as biological specimens tracking, for local and regional research projects mainly managed by National Cancer Centre Singapore. The incumbent will also support scientific research projects in NCCS through data science applications.

Genomics Pipelines
- Work with the team to build pipelines on BC Platform (AWS) such that genomic data can be processed effectively
- Organize the database such that all genomic and clinical data are linked and easily retrieved
- Build the pipelines for federated data sharing
Data Analysis
-Perform data analysis and visualization work to support research projects, grant applications, and publications
Database Management
- Manage the database used to host our clinical data to ensure that it is maintained operationally in a cost-effective manner
- Perform data cleaning, data standardization, and data structuring for data in the database

Requirements:

At least BSc in a relevant field (biology or bioinformatics or computational science)
At least 2 years of work experience in data science/ genomic data, with working knowledge of clinical and genomic data workflows
Technical experience in at least 1 of the following areas: Linux/cluster environments, computational genomic workflows (e.g. GATK), relational databases, Docker, cloud computing (e.g. AWS) and/or other data science systems
Possess an understanding of medical and clinical research terminology
Project management experience in oncology studies in a clinical trial laboratory services organization will be an advantage
Good planning skills with ability to collaborate with multiple stakeholders concurrently
Strong interpersonal skills

Guide clients through the data transformation journey, from strategy and roadmap development to execution
Work closely with clients and internal teams to ensure successful implementation of data projects, offering insights into how AI can further enhance data analytics and business intelligence.
Maintain a pulse on emerging data and AI technologies, tools, and practices, integrating this knowledge into projects to keep our offerings at the cutting edge.
Facilitate the smooth transition of AI concepts into practical data solutions, bridging the gap between traditional data analytics and innovative AI applications.
Provide mentorship and guidance to team members, fostering a culture of innovation and continuous improvement.
Requirements
Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Data Science, or a related technical field.
At least 5 years of experience in a solution architect role, focusing on data technologies, with some exposure to AI or a strong interest in developing AI-related skills.
Solid foundation in data architecture, data modeling, and data warehousing principles, with hands-on experience in big data technologies (e.g., Hadoop, Spark).
Familiarity with AI and machine learning concepts and their application in enhancing data analytics and decision-making processes.
Experience with cloud data platforms (AWS, Azure, Google Cloud) and understanding of how to architect for scalability, security, and performance.
Demonstrated ability in presales, including crafting technical solutions and proposals, and engaging effectively with clients.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, combined with excellent communication abilities, to translate complex technical concepts into business value.
Relevant certifications in data technologies, cloud services, or foundational AI/machine learning are desirable.

Roles & Responsibilities
Company Description
X0PA AI is an Artificial Intelligence Software as a Service (SaaS) start-up that aims to digitally transform the hiring process. We aim to save companies significant time and cost in hiring while achieving the highest level of objectivity, ultimately enhancing retention, loyalty and person to job and organization fit. Through our AI and Machine Learning capabilities, we can source, score and rank talent to identify the best talent for each organization. X0PA AI has recently launched X0PA ROOM, an AI enabled hybrid video interviewing and assessment platform.

Job Summary
The Product Manager is an exciting role that works in the intersection between all business units to determine product strategy, competitive intelligence, and contributing to the pricing and design for our suite of products.
Your mission is to continuously understand the digital customer needs and come up with products that fit their needs and align with company plans and resources

Job Responsibility
· Driving the strategy and direction of X0PA’s suite of products
· Collaborate closely with other business functions across Sales, Marketing, Customer Success, Operations, Engineering and Data Science to bring solutions to the customer’s problem
· Recommend the nature and scope of present and future product lines by reviewing product specifications and requirements, appraising new product ideas and product changes
· Assessing market competition by comparing the company's product to competitors' products
· Advocate for quality engineering solutions and architectural designs and strike a healthy balance between system scalability and localisation.
· Maintain and improve existing features, experiment, and launch new features.
· Drive performance excellency of your product through rigorous data analysis, from measuring impact and testing hypothesis, to conceptualising and executing features based on the data insights.
· Define success metrics and consistently measure the impact of your work.

What we’re looking for:
· Strong passion to innovate and build game-changing products while solving hard problems
· Do-whatever-it-takes attitude working in small teams, with limited resources and tight deadlines
· Comfort with ambiguity, strong bias towards action, ability to drive independent research and quickly deliver capabilities that drive customer value
· Strong communicator (verbal/written) with a open mindset towards collaboration and transparency
· Experience developing/launching products/technologies within one/more of the following: SaaS, enterprise
· Experience driving product vision, go-to-market strategy, and design discussions.
· Experience creating strategic product roadmaps, working with cross-functional teams.

Requirements:
· Bachelor’s degree in a technical field
· Experience managing day-to-day technical and design direction.
· Experience in one or more of the following: Cloud infrastructure, software as a service, big data, security and privacy, development and operations, or artificial intelligence/machine learning.
· Knowledge of multiple functional areas such as Product Management, Engineering, UX/UI, Sales, Customer Support, Finance or Marketing.
· Ability to influence multiple stakeholders without direct authority.

What We Offer
We are a bunch of fun loving, self-motivated professionals. We offer an inclusive, diverse and motivated work environment with huge learning opportunities.

In Singapore, we are located at JTC LaunchPad at One North which is a leading start-up hub in Asia and the world, a vibrant start-up ecosystem with opportunities to meet lot of like-minded individuals.

company_name: SINGAPORE-MIT ALLIANCE FOR RESEARCH AND TECHNOLOGY CENTRE
job_description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Job Description
We are hiring postdoctoral fellows interested in advancing the state of the art in data-efficient machine learning (AutoML, Bayesian optimization, neural architecture search, meta-learning, active learning) at SMART in the new program: Mens, Manus and Machina: How AI empowers people and the city in Singapore (M3S) for a period of 1 year with possible renewal/extension. With the recent emergence of large language models (LLMs), the postdoctoral fellows and research assistants will be investigating how these concepts (as well as important issues imvolving AI privacy, model auditability and updatability) can be applied in the context of LLMs, among others.
Research on topics related to data-efficient machine learning, such as AutoML, Bayesian Optimization, neural architecture search, data valuation, meta-learning, and active learning
Investigate how these concepts as well as important issues involving AI privacy, model audibility, and updatability can be applied in the context of LLMs
Develop, implement, and evaluate experiments to characterise the feasibility and performance of the proposed research ideas
Collaborate with other PhD and undergraduate students to publish research results in top-tier conferences and journals, with focus on venues associated with the above-mentioned areas
The postdoctoral fellows will be jointly advised by Prof. Daniela Rus (MIT CSAIL), Prof. Alex 'Sandy' Pentland (MIT Media Lab), and Assoc. Prof. Bryan Low (NUS School of Computing), and based at SMART (Singapore- MIT Alliance for Research & Technology) in Singapore. The postdoctoral fellows have the opportunity to collaborate with the PhD and undergraduate students in our research groups.

Some preliminary efforts can be found here:
https://transformers.mit.edu/ https://xqlin98.github.io/INSTINCT/ http://arxiv.org/abs/2310.00646

For more information on our research group and interests, visit
https://danielarus.csail.mit.edu/
https://www.media.mit.edu/people/sandy/overview/
https://www.comp.nus.edu.sg/~lowkh/research.html
Requirements
Ph.D. in computer science, computer engineering, machine learning, statistics, math, data science, operations research or other related disciplines.
Good publication record in the premier machine learning and AI conferences and/or journals is preferred.
Strong proficiency in programming.
To apply, please visit our website at: https://portal.smart.mit.edu/careers/career-opportunities
Interested applicants are invited to send in their
detailed CV with academic ranking (if any) and publication list,
a short cover letter describing your suitability for the position,
a concise description of research interests and future plans,
academic transcripts and
list of three references (to include reference names and contact information).
We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

Roles & Responsibilities
About Infosys:
Infosys is a global leader in next-generation digital services and consulting. We enable clients in 50 countries to navigate their digital transformation. With over three decades of experience in managing the systems and workings of global enterprises, we expertly steer our clients through their digital journey. We do it by enabling the enterprise with an AI-powered core that helps prioritize the execution of change. We also empower the business with agile digital at scale to deliver unprecedented levels of performance and customer delight. Our always-on learning agenda drives their continuous improvement through building and transferring digital skills, expertise, and ideas from our innovation ecosystem.
Visit www.infosys.com to see how Infosys (NYSE: INFY) can help your enterprise navigate your next.
Short Description:
If your passion is to build solutions that really make a difference to enterprises, the community and your world, Infosys is the right place for you.
Roles and Responsibilities:
As a Principal Consultant, you will anchor the enterprise level testing efforts, all the way from maturity assessment of enterprise testing processes, technology landscape, analyze, provide recommendations, and prepare a right strategy in client’s journey towards quality engineering. You will be pivotal to understand the use cases/problems and discovery of the overall testing solution and guide/transition to teams on project processes and deliverables. As a thoughtful and innovative leader, you will be the key advisor in transforming and QA modernization efforts by participating actively in solution architecture, design, development, and testing reviews. You will also anchor business pursuit initiatives, client training and in-house capability building. You will have the opportunity to shape value-adding consulting solutions that enable our clients to meet the changing needs of the global landscape.
Location for this position is in Singapore. This position may require 10% travel.
Skills /Competencies:
• 15+ years’ experience in leading the engagement effort for Medium/ High complexity assignments of Process & Automation led consulting.
• 5+ years’ experience in conducting testing organization assessments, making QE recommendations, and setting up QE organization.
• 5+ years’ experience in leading transformation initiatives across major programs and enterprise QA team.
• Implement, review and guide teams on project processes and deliverables; lead proposal development and anchor large pursuits.
• 2+ years’ experience in new testing offerings like Low code No code tools, AI/ML tools, Meta verse, Sustainability etc
• Contribute to organization branding via thought leadership, client training and in-house capability building.
• Lead and participate in client engagements on one or more of Infosys’s Test Consulting service offerings which includes, Agile DevOps, Program Test Strategy Definition or Technology QA Consulting (Ex: Extreme Automation, Data Services, Test Infrastructure, and tools etc.,).
• Strong Experience in Agile practices and Shift Left practices.
• Should have familiarity with DevOps, CT processes and In-sprint automation.
• Client and business acumen, influencing/negotiating skills with client/product vendors and external stakeholders, cultural affinity.

• Excellent communication & customer interfacing skills

• Experience in Program management and Stakeholder management
• Experience in cloud full stack development, architecture, design, integration, migration, testing and deploy functions.
• Lead client discussions to improve cloud initiatives and transformations.
• Has knowledge in KPI driven metrics and standards.

• IT cloud certifications like CompTIA Cloud+, CCSP, AWS, Microsoft Azure, Google Cloud, CISCO CCNA/CCNP, agile & other test competencies
The job also entails sitting as well as working at a computer for extended periods of time. Should be able to communicate by telephone, email or face to face.
Qualifications
• Bachelor’s degree or foreign equivalent from an accredited institution required.
• At least 15 years of experience with Information Technology in end-to-end test delivery and consulting.

Data Scientist Healthcare Analytics

Location: Singapore

Overview:
Leveraging advanced data science and machine learning techniques to revolutionize healthcare analytics. We are seeking a Senior Data Scientist with a strong background in healthcare analytics, computer vision, and machine learning to join our dynamic team. Develop and optimize computer vision solutions for the analysis and interpretation of medical images, focusing on cancer classification, image artifact detection, and patient stratification.

Stay abreast of the latest advancements in data science, machine learning, and healthcare technologies to drive innovation and continuous improvement.

Excellent analytical, problem-solving, and communication skills.
